characters: HOW BAD CAN THIS POSSIBLY BE
TED'S MOM, SINGING DELIVERY MAN, AND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MAINTENANCE WORKERS work on a large “Welcome to Thneedville” sign. The slogan below it reads, “Fantastic! Made of plastic! 100% Inorganic.” The camera pushes past them and flies through the town, down to a suburban stree

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We open in Thneedville, a city, they say, That was plastic and fake, and they liked it that way. A Town Without Nature. Not one living tree. So what happened to them? Cue the music! Let's see... EXT. THNEEDVILLE - PRESENT —- MORNING SONG: “THNEEDVILLE” The MUSIC starts up on a LONG SHOT down the street of Thneedville suburbs.  Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform All of the houses look basically the same. Electric trees line the streets instead of street lamps. An O'Hare Air delivery truck drives down the street. FLOOSH! An INFLATABLE PLASTIC BUSH inflates. FLOOSH! Another. FLOOSH! Another. Then-- POP! a bed of PLASTIC FLOWERS pops up in time with the mu complete with PLASTIC BUZZING BEES attached to wires.

dialogues.speaker: PLASTIC BEES
dialogues.text: (mechanical voice) Buzz! Buzz! Buzz! The DELIVERY MAN gets out of the truck and grabs an air bottle from it. He replaces an empty, used air bottle wit new one like a milkman. TITLE CARD: DR. SEUSS’ THE LORAX EXT: TED’S HOUSE - PRESENT - SAME Nearby, TED, an 11-year-old boy and our hero, hops out of second floor bedroom window, down a series of stairs, and flips over the railing into the air and lands on his SCOO He snaps on his goggles, revs his engine, and takes off d the street. PULL BACK TO A WIDE SHOT of the entire neighborhood. All of the front doors of the houses open simultaneously the PEOPLE OF THNEEDVILLE exit their houses singing happi

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: In Thneedville it's a brand new dawn! PEOPLE drive by in their personalized vanity cars, includ a BUSINESSMAN in his large STEAMROLLER SUV.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: With brand new cars And houses And lawns! We pull back to see the rest of the neighborhood joining traffic. Ted follows behind them on his scooter.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here in got-all-that-we-need-ville! 2.  Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform A MAN uses a bike pump to inflate his flaccid plastic bus He’s not paying attention and pumps the bush until it POP knocking him over.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The people of Thneedville sing as they commute to work pa rows of FAKE TREES.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: In Thneedville we manufacture our trees A little Girl, MARIE, uses a tire swing hanging from a me tree.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Each one is made in factories. MAINTENANCE MEN opens up a PANEL in the electric tree revealing it’s filled with BATTERIES.

dialogues.speaker: MAINTENANCE MAN
dialogues.text: And uses 96 batteries! The lights on the tree go out as the batteries fall out. of the Maintenance Men quickly tries to pick them up. Ted rides by on his scooter. The Singing Delivery Man walks up to an apartment, carryi large O’HARE AIR BOTTLE.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: In Thneedville the air's not so clean The Singing Delivery Man walks into a WOMAN’S APARTMENT.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: A WOMAN opens the door and lets the Singing Delivery Man He replaces the large bottle of O’Hare Air hooked to her Fresh Air System.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: So we buy it fresh! The Singing Delivery Man PLOPS the bottle into the machin time with the beat. She hands him money for the delivery. 3.  Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform

dialogues.speaker: SINGING DELIVERY MAN
dialogues.text: It comes out this machine! She takes a whiff of the fresh air. He takes a whiff of t money.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Aaaaah!

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: In satisfaction's guaranteed-ville! EXT: DOWNTOWN - PRESENT —- SAME Downtown a group of BUSINESSPEOPLE sing and dance as they head for work. The Maintenance Workers sweep garbage towa an open manhole.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: In Thneedville The Singing Delivery Man jumps in front of the Maintenanc Works and starts dancing.

dialogues.speaker: SINGING DELIVERY MAN
dialogues.text: We don't want to knoooow! He does a spin and accidentally disappears down a MANHOLE

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Where the smog and trash and chemicals go A LITTLE BOY swims through the Thneedville River (which i unnaturally blue) wearing a big smile. His parents happil help him out of the river and give him a big hug.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: I just went swimming, and now I glow! He glows and smiles even more. Ted zips by him on the scooter.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: We see a CHUBBY SURFER surfing on the fake ocean. A SNOWBOARDING TEEN zips down the snowy mountain next to hi

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: In Thneedville we have fun year- round! 4.  Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform The Snowboarding Teen turns and sends a CLUMP OF SLUSH fl and it goes down the back of a GUY’S SWIMSUIT.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We surf and snowboard right in town! A group of SUNBATHERS sing like a church choir, holding t sun reflectors like choir folders.

dialogues.speaker: SUNBATHING CHOIR
dialogues.text: We thank the Lord for all we've got! The Singing Delivery Man sings a beautiful solo as we rev that the choir is singing at the grand opening of a new PARKING LOT (called Thneedville Parking).

dialogues.speaker: SUNBATHING MAN
dialogues.text: Including this brand new parking lot! As the choir sings with religious fervor about the parkin lot, people step our of their parked vehicles, get on the roofs of their cars, and JOYOUSLY sing along.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Parking lot! Parking lot! Nearby a WOMAN and her SON fly kites propelled by large f

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN WITH KITE
dialogues.text: It’s him! Everyone looks up and sees the O’HARE AIR BLIMP, which sp out smog from its exhaust. Projected on it’s massive LCD screen is ALOYSIUS O'HARE, the financial king of Thneedvi owner of the O’Hare Air Co. Pudgy and clownish and tacky loved by everyone. He leans out from the window and waves the people down below.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Ooh look! It's Aloysius O'Hare (Aloysius O'Hare) The man who found a way to sell air

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: O'HARE turns around in his office chair and walks out fro behind his desk. 5.  Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: O'Hare stands on Mooney’s hands outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: And became a zillionaire! He dives off and falls down toward the ground. His parach opens revealing an ad for O’Hare Air.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Hip-hooray, hip-hooray! As they celebrate we catch up with Ted, who is excitedly buying a REMOTE CONTROL AIRPLANE from a VENDOR at his kio He gives the vendor his money and takes the new airplane, ecstatic.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hip-hip-hooray! We're in the center of town. Here comes the elaborately choreographed big finish, reminiscent of “Consider Yourse from Oliver. The huge mob engulfs Ted at the toy kiosk. People dance w their shopping bags, tossing them to each other. Businesspeople dance with their briefcases.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In Thneedville We love living this way! Suddenly the Singing Delivery Man reappears in frame, pus the BAND LEADER aside, grabs his baton, and leads the MARCHING BAND down the street.

dialogues.speaker: SINGING DELIVERY MAN
dialogues.text: It's like living in paradise!

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: It's perfect! And that's how it will stay!

dialogues.speaker: SINGING DELIVERY MAN
dialogues.text: Oh yeah! Fireworks go off above the town. O'Hare walks up the steps of his oversized limo waving to people like a politician before he gets in. The Singing Delivery Man dances on top of O’Hare’s limo w spinning cheer-leading batons. 6.  Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Here in love the life we lead-ville Destined to succeed-ville We are all agreed-ville We're happy here in CLOSE-UPS on various MOUTHS making the “thhh” sound.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thhhh-- Back to the wide shot showing the entire center of town.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --needville! As soon as the song's over, everyone immediately goes bac what they were doing. Mooney and McGurk help the frozen Singing Delivery Man off the roof of the limo. And out of the crowd zips Ted on his scooter, carrying th bag with the airplane in it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted rides his scooter through town with the confidence of someone who knows the place like the back of his hand. EXT: AUDREY’S HOUSE - PRESENT - CONTINUOUS He ends up suburbia. Stops in front of a house. Gets off his scooter. Reaches into the bag and pulls out the REMOT CONTROLLED AIRPLANE. Ted smiles as he admires it. Ted places it on the ground. Operates the remote control, and it TAKES OFF. Ted then flies the plane in a series of loop-dee-loops and then straight into someone’s backyard. But instead of being upset, he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yes. He runs up to the front door of the house. RINGS the doorbell. Multiple times. As the door opens, Ted goes int a slow-mo fantasy, revealing-- AUDREY. A teenage girl, beautiful and cool, and much too for Ted. Although he doesn’t see it that way. He looks up at her worshipfully, suddenly awkward in her presence.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, Ted. 7.  Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform Ted breaks out of the fantasy.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (trying to play it cool) Oh, hey, Audrey. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Did your ball land in my backyard again?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What?! No. Model airplane. This time. Audrey smiles. Then leans in to Ted, conspiratorially.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Hey--do you wanna see something cool? Ted stares back at Audrey. Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! Audrey turns to go into the house. Ted follows her, spray breath freshener into his mouth as he enters. EXT: AUDREY’S BACKYARD - PRESENT - LATER Audrey takes her hands away from Ted’s eyes and he looks to see a MASSIVE MURAL in progress on the wall depicting lush valley filled with TRUFFULA TREES. Ted stares up at painting in awe.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa. Did you p-- Did you paint this?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What?! Are you kidding? This is amazing. (points to trees) What are those?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: (smiles) Those are trees. Real ones. They used to grow all around here. (MORE )
Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And people said that the touch of their tufts was softer than anything, even silk. And they smelled like butterfly milk.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Wow. What does that even mean?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I know, right? Audrey grabs Ted’s arms and swings him over her head, so both fall to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whaaaa! (pained) Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What I want more than anything in the whole world is to see a real living tree, growing in my backyard.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (thinking) So...if, say-- I’m just thinking out loud here... if a guy somehow got you one...

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Well, I'd probably marry him on the spot. (makes a face) I bet that sounds crazy. Does that sound crazy? Ted looks up adoringly at Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: No. Not crazy! (clears his throat) Not crazy at all. Ted smiles. A boy with a plan.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ted sits at the dinner table with his MOM and GRAMMY NORM He absentmindedly pokes at a PIECE OF JELLO shaped like BROCCOLI. 9. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 1 TED’S MOM Ted, honey, don’t play with your food. You either, Mom. Grammy Norma dribbles a JELLO BROCCOLI like a basketball. She tosses it up and pops it in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: So...Mom. Do you happen to know if there’s like anyplace where I could get a real tree? Grammy Norma reacts to this. TED’S MOM Ted, we already have a tree. It’s the latest model.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I mean like a real one, that-- that grows out of the ground or whatever. You know, like a real tree. TED’S MOM (makes face) Really? You’d rather have some dirty, messy lump of wood that just sticks out of the ground and it does what? I don’t even know what it does. What’s it’s purpose? Look what we’ve got. It’s the Oak- a-matic--the only tree with its own remote! She points a REMOTE at the tree outside. TED’S MOM (CONT’D) Summer, autumn, winter-- The tree changes with each click to match the season. TED’'S MOM (CONT’D) --and disco! The tree now lights up in neon colors like a disco floor. And plays a Muzak version of “The Hustle.” Ted’s Mom shimmies and sings along. TED’'S MOM (CONT’D) Doot doot doot doo-doot doo-doot doot doot! Come on, Ted, get into it, dance with the tree. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 1 Ted sinks in his seat, mortified.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Mom... Oh, it hurts Mom. Please stop. Ted’s Mom clicks the remote and the music stops.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sooooco, anyway, let’s just say I need a tree. Where would I go? What do I do?

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: Then you know what? You’d need to find the Once-ler. Ted turns to Grammy Norma, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: The-- the what? TED’S MOM Mom, it’s not really the time for one of your, you know, magical fables, okay?

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s right. I forgot. I’m old and can’t even remember to put my teeth in. TED’S MOM Stand down. That’s not what I meant.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: No really, I forgot my teeth. Would you be a dear and go get them for me? TED’S MOM (sighs) Sure, mom. She exits. As soon as she’s gone Grammy Norma plops in he teeth and turns dramatically to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: (conspiratorially) Okay, here’s the deal. The Once- ler is the man who knows what happened to the trees. You want one, you need to find him. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 1

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (suspicious) “The Once-ler”? Mmm-hm, okay. Grammy is this a real thing that we're talking about now?

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: Oh, he’s real, all right.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Well...where can I find him? Grammy Norma appears behind Ted, scaring him. She gives h an intense look. CLAPS and the LIGHTS DIM.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: “Far outside of town where the grass never grows and the wind smells slow-and-sour when it blows (makes spooky wind noises) .--and no birds ever sing excepting old crows...” (suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: CAW
dialogues.text: Ted jumps. Grammy Norma catches him.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa! Quit doing that!

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: That’s the place where the Once-ler lives.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Wait--outside of town?

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ted empties an old jar filled with coins and collects THR NICKELS.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: People used to say if you brought him fifteen cents...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: RATTLE! Ted opens up the junk drawer and retrieves a NAIL Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 1

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ---a nail... EXT: TED’S HOUSE - PRESENT - EVENING Ted searches around for snails. Picks a shell up. A GREAT GREAT-GREAT-GRANDFATHER SNAIL, wrinkled and with a long beard, pops out.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...and the shell of a great-great- great grandfather snail, he’d tell you everything. Ted smiles. He’s got everything he needs.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted rides his scooter through to the edge of town. He loo up and sees a large pipe above his head with sign reading “VENT OUT.” He follows the pipe which leads to a door hig up in the middle of the wall. There is no way to get to i Nearby, Ted spots a box on the wall with a warning sign w reads, “AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY.” Ted looks around, ope the box, and pushes the red button inside, which extends brick from the wall out towards him.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa! Other bricks extend out forming a staircase up to the doo Ted gets back on his scooter and rides it up the stairs t the door where he sees a sign reading, “Outside of Town.” turns a lever and the door opens like a bank vault. A RED LIGHT above the door starts blinking. The camera continues up into the sky, where the O’Hare Ai Blimp hovers above. EXT: O’HARE’S BLIMP —- PRESENT - NIGHT Establishing. INT: O’HARE’S BLIMP - PRESENT - SAME Aloysius O’Hare sits at his desk. Standing across from hi are two MARKETING GUYS. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 1

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: Mr. O'Hare, what we’ve got for you is something that is going to take O'Hare Air to the next level.

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: Now, Mr. O’Hare, I know what you’re thinking. One, I’ve gotten rich selling people air that’s fresher than the stinky stuff outside. Two, here’s the important one, how could I possibly make even more money? (laughs ) We can tell you, sir, we can tell you!

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: Check out this commercial. Huh?! He clicks his remote and a COMMERCIAL appears on a screen

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: TWO GUYS sit in chairs on a rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GUY
dialogues.text: Well, here goes another lame Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GUY
dialogues.text: Dude...I don't think so. (chuckles ) He smiles and pulls a six-pack of O'HARE AIR out of a coo

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GUY
dialogues.text: Huh? Pops one open, funky music begins playing, the sun comes and suddenly a bunch of BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE show up.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GUY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah! Right here.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GUY
dialogues.text: Man!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GUY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 1 TWO MEN open bottles and blow the air into their mouths.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GUY
dialogues.text: Whaaaaa?! A hot chick opens up a bottle in her face and it makes he hair blow sexily. The First Guy is amazed. Instant party! He and his buddy click their bottles together.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: O'Hare Purified Air. Freshness to go! (beat) Please breathe responsibly. INT: O’HARE’S OFFICE - PRESENT - SAME The commercial over O’Hare rubs his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: Oh my goodness.

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: Love it.

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: Yeah... Then he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me! You really think people are stupid enough to buy this?! The Marketing Guys keep pushing each other out of the way vying for O’Hare’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: Our research shows that if you put something in a plastic bottle, people will buy it.

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: Exactly, and-- Marketing Guy #1 shoves Marketing Guy #2 aside and points a chart showing air quality going down and sales going up Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 1

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: And what’s more, when we build a new factory to make the plastic bottles, the air quality’s just going to get worse.

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: Which will make people want our air even more and drive sales... where? Through the roof! O'Hare nods his approval.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: So in other words: the more smog in the sky... (chuckles ) ...the more people will buy. The Marketing Guys laugh.

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: Genius! That’s why he’s a genius!

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: It even rhymes!

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: I’m aware it rhymes. Suddenly a RED LIGHT on O’Hare’s desk starts flashing. He looks at it. The door opens and his thugs MOONEY and MCGU step in. The Marketing Guys grab their charts and run off

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: Coats! Big coats!

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: What do you two knuckleheads want?! I’m in the middle of a meeting! Mooney holds out a HANDHELD DEVICE. It reads “SECURITY ALERT,” and shows BLACK AND WHITE FOOTAGE of Ted trying t get out the door. O'Hare stares at it. Frowns.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?! Why is he leaving town? No one ever leaves town! (beat) See what he’s up to. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 1

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ted looks in though the door in the wall, revealing a lar dark room. He rides through the maze-like room on his scooter, passing a stream of gluppity-glup pouring out fr series of pipes.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa! A security camera watches him drive by. He continues over the stream on a small bridge until he reaches an exit.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted comes out into the world outside of town. It’s a desolate landscape. Filled with garbage and filthy water tree stumps.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Huh? He’s seeing his world as it really is. And it’s a nightma Ted steels himself and continues on past the graveyard of tree stumps. A storm brews in the smoggy sky and he looks up to see an Thneed billboard. Lightning FLASHES, distracting Ted, who almost beheaded by a series of old, rusted axe blades. He dodges and weaves through them. He looks behind him to reveal it’s a destroyed Axe Hacker. Lightning FLASHES in sky again.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, man... Ted stops at a large ravine where a bridge is out. He loo around to see if there is another way to cross and spots old barrels and a plank of wood. He gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted revs his scooter and then takes off toward the ravine where he has setup the barrel and the plank of wood as a makeshift ramp. He intends to jump it, but as he reaches end of the ramp he plummets down the side. He SCREAMS, but picks up so much speed that he drives rig back up the other side. He flies into the air and bounces back down. He breathes a SIGH OF RELIEF and continues on journey up the side of a mountain pass. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 1

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The city is far behind him now. Ted scooters through the fog, past warning signs reading, “Stay out!” and “I mean and down the worn path where he comes to a stop in front hand-painted street sign covered in CROWS. He gets off hi scooter and as he approaches it, the crows take off, revealing that it reads “The Street of the Lifted Lorax.” He keeps moving forward through the fog until he comes to rickety old shack with a boarded-up window that looks lik strong wind might knock it over (otherwise known as The Lerkim). Ted stares at the spooky image, frozen. Then tak a deep breath and continues up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa... All right... He arrives in front of the Lerkim, which only looks creep up close. He continues forward, not noticing that someone is watching him from inside the boarded up window. Ted walks past a small ring of stones. The word “Unless” carved into one of them. Ted removes the money, nail, and snail from his pocket. T snail shakes his head, giving Ted a look like, “Let’s get of here.” Ted ignores the snail and heads up the steps leading to t front door. The wind whistles, and the old wood CREAKS beneath his feet. He gets more nervous with each step. Th railing falls over scaring him. Then he arrives at the do with a sign above it reading, “THE ONCE-LER”. Ted stares it, then takes a deep breath and moves his shaking finger toward the doorbell. He presses it then-- WHIRRRRRRRR...CLANK! Immediately a crazy Seussian machine activated.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay... It catapults him into the air.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the--?! A clamp catches by the seat of his pants just before he h the ground and hoists him back up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aiiiiiiiii! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 1 KA-LUNK! The contraption comes to a stop, leaving Ted dangling in front of the Lerkim. He opens his eyes, surprised to be alive. Struggles to get loose. Two YELLOW EYES and two GREEN-GLOVED ARMS appear in the window. Ted, still hanging upside-down, stares at them, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who are you?!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaaah! Ted squirms and wriggles like a worm on a hook. The voice barks even louder.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: WHO ARE YOU?! And what are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (out of breath) I’m Ted. I’m Ted! Oh, can’t breathe. Are you--are you...the Once-ler? Oh, man.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Didn't you read the signs? No one is supposed to come here! The clamp spins Ted around, lowers him to the ground and him go. Then it begins pushing him back down the path tow Thneedville.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Get out of here and leave me alone! And don’t let the boot hit you on the way out.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: The boot? A mechanical boot kicks Ted in the butt.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa, hello! Ow... He stops and turns back around, holding out the payment i his hand. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 2

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, people say that if someone brings you this stuff that you’1l tell them about trees! There’s a pause. That word got the Once-ler’s attention. The mechanical arm comes back and grabs Ted again bringin him up to the window.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, no-no-no-no! Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Trees?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yeah. Real ones, you know, that grow out of the ground. A very long pause.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry...it’s just... Well, I didn’t think anyone still cared about trees.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Well, that’s me! The guy who still cares. I’m here! Hey, what-- Whoa! The mechanical arm deposits Ted on the pile of rocks.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You want to know about trees? About what happened to them? Why they’re all gone? Ted looks up at the window.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (whispers ) It’s because of me. A look of shock comes over Ted’s face.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Wait, what? The Once-ler lowers a long metal tube, the Whisper-Ma-Pho out of his window. Ted leans in to listen. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 2

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s because of me! The Whisper-Ma-Phone blows out dust causing Ted to COUGH.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And my invention. The Thneed. It was an amazing product that could do the job of a thousand! The Once-ler holds a Thneed out and shows it to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Alright...sounds ridiculous. But, I mean, that’s cool.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're darn right it was cool! (sighs) It all started a long time ago...

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Can we start not so long ago maybe?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Do you want a tree?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes...

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Then it all started a long, long time ago...

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Cross dissolve from Old Once-ler to a much younger Once-l sitting on a COVERED WAGON which is hitched to a sad-look mule named MELVIN in front of a nice house with a CAR par in front. Standing there to see him off are his MOTHER, h moronic brothers BRETT and CHET, his monstrous GREAT-AUNT GRIZELDA, and his unctuous UNCLE UBB.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was a young man leaving home...

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Well, here I go, Mom. Off to change the world with my Thneed! I’m actually doin’ it! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 2 ONCE-LER’S MOM Yes. (sweetly) But just remember, Oncie--if somehow your invention ends up a failure instead of a success... (abruptly switches gear) Well, it wouldn’t surprise me at all! The family LAUGHS at this.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE UBB
dialogues.text: Hey! Chet punches Once-ler in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: CHET
dialogues.text: Nice wheels! Burn! Melvin kicks Chet back over toward the family. The Once-l LAUGHS IT OFF.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Haha. Yeah, burn! But you'll see, okay--I’m gonna prove you all wrong! C’mon, Melvin! More laughter from the family. The Once-ler tries to igno this.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The wagon makes its way across a country road. The Once-l strums his ELECTRIC GUITAR.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So there I was at the very bottom with nothing but a wagon, a mule, and a completely irrational sense of optimism.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: (singing) Na na nana na na Oh bop-bah-da-da-do-do-do Thneed-Thneed-Thneed, Thneeda- Thneed-Thneed-Thneed

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was searching the globe, obsessed with finding the perfect material for my Thneed. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 2

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (singing) La-la-la-la-la...

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler sleeps as MELVIN his mule continues on.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But I’d had absolutely no success. Until one day...I found paradise... Melvin kicks the Once-ler awake.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: (startled) Oh! We’re gonna be there soon! I’m sure it’s like-- Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: The TRUFFULA VALLEY. It is paradise. They look around and see blue skies, green grass, a flowing river, woodland creatures and hundreds of tall TRUFFULA TREES with their colorful tufts swaying in the afternoon breeze. It’s magical.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the most beautiful place, okay, I have ever seen. The music swells. Then the Once-ler looks down to see THR HUMMING-FISH walk up and strike a pose in front of him. T look up and gesture towards the beautiful valley behind t

dialogues.speaker: HUMMING-FISH
dialogues.text: Taa-daa! They each HUM as they dive off into a nearby pond.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Whoa! The Once-ler watches as the Humming-Fish continue HUMMING down the hill past a fat Bar-Ba-Loot, named LOU, who stuf his face with Truffula fruit. PIPSQUEAK a baby Bar-Ba-Loo sits next to him eating his own piece of fruit. Then a series of Bar-Ba-Loots jump onto Lou’s head and stand on another's shoulders to get to some fruit high in the tree Pipsqueak is passed up the chair of Bar-Ba-Loots and he g the fruit for the group. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 2 In the tuft above them, a SWOMEE-SWAN flies off into the revealing a nest with BILL, a baby Swomee-Swan, in it. Bi YAWNS and HONKS at camera. We follow the Swomee-Swan as it flies through the forest, past a stream and to a clear blue pond where-- The Trio of Humming-Fish climb out of the water onto a ro and HUM like an a cappella group. Then they slide back do into the water and their HUMMING becomes GURGLING. Melvin pulls the wagon down into the valley, where all of curious animals gather around them. The Once-ler hops dow from the wagon with his guitar and starts begins rocking

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is it! Two Bar-Ba-Loots look at each other, confused.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the place! These Truffula Trees are just'a what I need! The Bar-Ba-Loots hear him playing and come over to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gonna chop one down and make my Thneed. But first-- THWACK! As he stands up he accidentally smacks a Bar-ba-l with his guitar. Then he tosses it up into the air and runs off screen. On Bar-Ba-Loot pushes another out of the way as the guitar f back down to the ground and nearly clobbers him. The Once-ler sings and dances through the valley, followe the curious animals.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Na na nanana na Na na nanana na (to animals) Now you! The animals, caught up in the music, join in singing and dancing with the Once-ler. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 2

dialogues.speaker: ANIMALS
dialogues.text: Na na nanana na Nana na nana na na na! Lou gets into it and doesn’t realize the other animals ha danced off after the Once-ler. He opens his eyes and runs after them.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: That’s great! (scats to the music)

dialogues.speaker: ANIMALS
dialogues.text: Na na nanana na Nana na nana na na na! Bob-shoo-bop Bob-shoo-bop He goes into the back of the wagon, pulls out a spatula, sings into it like a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: So now our friendship can begin. Hand-and-hand and wing and fin. The Once-ler goes back into the wagon and begins unpackin obliviously tossing tools over his head at the animals.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's nothing you and I can't do So let's all make my dreams come true! Yodelhoo... Yodelay-hee-hoo... A saw, shovel, pruning shears, and an axe land right in f of different animals, almost hitting them. Then a hair trimmer bounces past shaving the stomach of a Bar-Ba-Loot who quickly covers up, embarrassed. A tube of toothpaste lands in front of a Humming-Fish. Th a mallet lands on that, squirting the toothpaste all over face. A beard trimmer flies out and shaved one of the Bar-Ba-Lo A tube of toothpaste explodes on another one.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMALS
dialogues.text: Na na nanana na Nana na nana na na na! Na na nanana na Nana na nana na na na! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 2 The wagon unpacked, the oblivious Once-ler pulls out an a and goes for the big finish.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Oh Yodelay-Yodelay-heee-hoooo-- Instead of jubilantly joining in the chorus, the angry mo animals have all turned against the Once-ler. One Swomee-Swan has a stick and taps it against his winge palm menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: LOU
dialogues.text: Na na nanana na Lou dances over and then notices that everyone else is an and he stops singing.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. Come on! Where’s my back up chorus? The Bar-Ba-Loots GROWL at the Once-ler. A Humming-Fish picks up a set of egg beaters and winds th menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler turns back to his wagon and grabs TWO LARGE SACKS.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Ah-ha! Then he realizes they are filled with marshmallows.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: oh! An Angry Bar-ba-loot lunges for him and the Once-ler scre like a girl, holding the sack up as a shield. RIIIIP! MARSHMALLOWS fly out into the air. The marshmallow rain down into the angry animals’ mouths, eat them. MMMMM! It’s like a switch has been flipped.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMALS
dialogues.text: Ooooh! They all love marshmallows! All of the animals frolic and play in them. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 2 A Bar-Ba-Loot jumps through the air in slo-mo catching on his mouth. Down below, other Bar-Ba-Loots spin around grabbing as ma in their mouths as they can. Humming-Fish eat ones floati in the water. A Swomee-Swan drops Pipsqueak down into the pond, which i filled with them. A Humming Fish rides on a Bar-Ba-Loot through the marshmallows like a Gondolier. The Once-ler looks down at Pipsqueak who has a huge smile revealing dozens of marshmallows crammed in his mouth. Clearly he’s going for the record. The Once-ler looks dow at him with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey-hey-hey-hey. Wait. Wait a minute. The Once-ler looks around to see where the voice is comin from.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Back to the Once-ler looking down at Ted from his Lerkim.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Um, yeah, that’s awesome. You know, feeding junk food to forest animals. That’s great. But, uh, is there a musical number where you show me how to get a tree? ‘Cause I’d love to hear that one. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Right after the musical number about the kid who kept interrupting the story and was never heard from again. Mm-hm. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Right, got it. (gestures with hand) Proceed. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 2

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler puts on a pair of work gloves and grabs a la AXE.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: All right! Here we go. About to make a Thneed. About to change the world. The animals all stare at the shiny metal axe and watch th Once-ler as he walks over to the tall Truffula tree. He raises the axe up over his head. The animals watch curiously. CHOP! The axe cuts into the tree with a sound that echoes through the valley. The tree creaks and moans as it falls and hits the ground with a THUD. The animals react in horror. What did he just do? The Once-ler stares at the tree, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Check it out guys... Huh? He looks around, noticing all of the animals are gone.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, where'd everybody go? He shrugs, then grabs the tree by the trunk and drags it toward his cottage.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler continues the story.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Little did I know that by chopping down that tree I had just summoned a mystical creature as old as time itself. The legendary--slightly annoying--guardian of the forest. (beat) The Lorax. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The animals investigate the stump. A Humming-Fish pokes a it. Suddenly the ground starts rumbling. The animals scatter. There’s a LOUD NOISE and a FLASH OF LIGHT as a thundersto shoots out of the stump. The animals watch from a safe distance. The one fish slaps the other fish for poking the stump. The Swomee-Swans shove their head in the ground like ostriches. A Bar-Ba-Loot tries it and knocks himself out. A series of lightning bolts hit the stump causing an explosion that reverberates through the valley. Lou struggles to stand up in the wind. A fish flies into face, knocking him over. The whole thunderstorm is sucked back into the stump and pops-— THE LORAX. Shortish, brownish, and in charge. He slowly stands up. Sees the stump, reacts horrified.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: (in disbelief) What the w-- Who the-- Oh! The animals watch as he collects some ROCKS and stacks th on the stump, creating a memorial. Pipsqueak sees this. H brings over a rock and offers it to the Lorax. Other anim join him. When they are done they take a moment of silence for the stump. Pipsqueak walks over and holds the Lorax’s hand. L awkwardly grabs the Lorax’s other hand and starts blubber Then the Lorax hears the Once-ler WHISTLING and spots him ripping tufts from the Truffula tree. The Lorax furrows h brow and walks over to investigate. The Once-ler shakes the tufts like pom-poms as he pulls t off the felled tree. Then he pulls another piece of the tuft and the Lorax com up with it.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 3 The Once-ler is startled and trips, falling to the ground

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (accusingly) Did you chop down this tree? Pipsqueak curiously wanders over to them.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: What? Uh... no. Who did it? (gasps, points offscreen) What’s that?! The Lorax looks away and Once-ler drops the axe onto Pipsqueak.

dialogues.speaker: PIPSQUEAK
dialogues.text: oy!

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: I think he did it. The Lorax isn’t buying it.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Leave! Vacate the premises! Take your axe and get out! The Once-ler stares at the Lorax.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: And who are you? The Once-ler pokes the Lorax in the belly.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: What-- what?!! I’m-- I’m the Lorax! (off Once-ler’s blank look) Guardian of the forest. I speak for the trees. (still blank) So you're telling me you just didn’t see me magically appear out of that stump? With all the lightning and thunder and stuff? You didn’t see any of that?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: No. But that sounds amazing. Can I see some of that? Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 3

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Uh... yeah, I could show you. But that’s not how it works.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: (condescending) Okay, um... Didn’t really happen. (beat) Oh, I know what you want! (pokes Lorax’s nose) He reaches into his pocket and pulls out a MARSHMALLOW. Holds it out.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (baby talk) I’ve got one of these for the cutest little guy I ever saw. Yummy-yummy-yummy... The Lorax stares at the marshmallow.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: How dare you! Give me that! He grabs the marshmallow. Sniffs it. It smells good.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hmmm... I’m going to eat this, but I am highly offended by it. He plops it into his mouth. Then makes his way over to th Once-ler’s tent-house which is being supported by stakes ropes. Kick out a STAKE. The canvas starts to sag.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Whoa, what are you-- What?! Hey, mustache! Will you stop that! The Lorax continues circling around the tent-house pullin stakes. The Once-ler grabs his HAMMER and follows, poundi them back in.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s your deal, man?!

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Time for you to go, beanpole! They circle faster and faster around the tent-house, the Lorax pulling up stakes and the Once-ler pounding them ba in. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 3

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Pull ‘em right out and I’m just gonna put ‘em right back in. I can do this all day. Unbelievable. Until the Once-ler turns a corner and is about to bring h hammer down on-- Pipsqueak. The Lorax has placed him right where the stake would have been. The Lorax holds up his hand to stop the Once-ler.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Whoa! Stop right there! Stop it! So you’d hammer one of nature’s innocent creatures? The Lorax pats Pipsqueak on the head and he happily runs offscreen.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: (horrified) What?! No, I would never hit this little guy. You, on the other hand, I would gladly pound you and your mustache into the ground. The Lorax turns to all of the watching animals.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Behold the intruder and his violent ways! (to the Once-ler) Shame on you. For shame. The Once-ler drops the hammer and hides it behind his fee Then he sees all of the animals nodding their heads in agreement. The Once-ler’s had it.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: All right, you know what, that’s it. (points at Lorax) You listen to me, you furry meatloaf. I’m gonna chop down as Many trees as I need. Okay, news flash, not going anywhere. End of story! He turns and enters his cottage. His sticks his tongue ou and does RASPBERRIES to the Lorax before slamming the doo behind him. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 3 INT: ONCE-LER’S COTTAGE - PAST - CONTINUOUS The Once-ler sighs heavily, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Then you leave me no choice. Startled, the Once-ler turns and sees that the Lorax is somehow inside with him. He points a threatening finger a the Once-ler and speaks in a spooky voice as if he’s cast a spell.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you’re not gone by the time the sun sets on this valley, all the forces of nature will be unleashed upon you and curse you until the end of your days! (beat) You have been warned. Lorax turns to make a dramatic exit, but can’t reach the doorknob of Once-ler’s door. He hops a couple of times. Finally, the Once-ler lets him out.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. Then:

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: You have been warned! The Lorax storms out and slams the door, leaving the Once alone in his cottage.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Back to the Once-ler looking down at Ted from his Lerkim. Ted is clearly entranced by the story.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: But I didn’t listen to his warning. And you won't believe what happened that night...

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What? Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 3 Beat.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: If you want to hear more, come back tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Hey, wait, wait! Tomorrow? The Whisper-Ma-Phone gets pulled back up. Ted leaps up an grabs it, getting carried up.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whooooa! The Whisper-Ma-Phone retracts into the shutters. Ted is flipped up into a bucket hanging near the window.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you serious right now? Ugh! You live in the middle of nowhere! It stinks out here! Don’t make me come back.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Then I guess you don’t really want to hear the rest of the story. Once-ler quickly drops the bucket down, and Ted with it. bucket stops right before the ground and the claw comes d and knocks Ted out of it. Ted gets back up and shouts up the Once-ler.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no, I do. I really do. I wanna hear the story, I just--

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nah! You don’t have what it takes. Goodbye! His green arms leave the window. Ted realizes he’s pushed too much, and does an about-face.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait! I have what it takes. It’s alright. It’s okay. I’ll come back. It’s no problem! Ted turns and quickly heads down the path back to his scooter. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 3

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See, here I am leaving! Walking away now. I’11 see you tomorrow! The Once-ler watches Ted as he runs down the path.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (to himself) Hmmmmm. Maybe...just maybe. INT: AUDREY’S HOUSE - TED’S DAYDREAM - DAY CLOSE ON a BIRTHDAY CAKE with sixteen candles. Audrey sta in front of the cake as a bunch of PARTYGOERS sing.

dialogues.speaker: PARTYGOERS
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday to you! Audrey closes her eyes, makes a wish, and blows out the candles.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’d you wish for, Audrey? Audrey smiles.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Well, I’d love to tell you, but sadly, according to the universal wish laws, I cannot.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, I know what she wished for. Audrey turns and sees Ted playing the piano on a balcony above. In a TUXEDO. He hops onto the railing of a spiral staircase and slides down to the first floor, where he continues sliding past a WAITER who holds a tray with an milkshake. Ted grabs it as he continues sliding to a TALL OBJECT covered with a VELVET CLOTH.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Was it perhaps... (takes a sip from the shake) Uh--this? He removes the velvet cloth, revealing a POTTED TRUFFULA TREE. The party erupts in CHEERS and APPLAUSE and FLASHBU POP. Audrey can’t believe her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Ted, you-- You didn’t. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 3

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh, no, I totally did. Happy Birthday, Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh... The crowd starts chanting.

dialogues.speaker: PARTYGOERS
dialogues.text: Kiss him! Kiss him! Kiss him! Ted turns to Audrey and shrugs. What can we do? Audrey looks Ted right in the eyes. She moves in for a ki and Ted puckers up. TED'S MOM’S VOICE (0.S.) Ted!

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ted comes out of his daydream. He is sitting at the table kissing a CEREAL BOX (EMPTY-0'S). TED’S MOM Ted. Tedster.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Huh? His Mom sits next to him. TED’S MOM You're kissing the cereal again, hon. Ted realizes he’s been caught kissing a cereal box.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What? I just...I like-- I like this cereal. What one is this? Yeah! Ted shoves a huge spoonful of cereal in his mouth. TED’S MOM O-kay... Well I’1l make sure to buy extra next time for you. Ted gets up and rushes for the door. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 3

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: All right, cool. Hey, I gotta run. I gotta go do...a thing...so... I’1ll see you guys. Mom quickly reaches out a hand and grabs him by his shirt collar, stopping him. TED’S MOM Whoa, whoa, whoa! You're not going anywhere, young man. It’s Sunday. You know what that means? Family time. And we’re all playing board games! Ted's face falls. Grammy Norma watches, interested.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: But--

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ted sits at the table with his Mom and Grammy Norma playi word game. Grammy Norma surveys the board, holding a lett in each hand.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: Hmmm. Hmmm. Oooh! No... Ted SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (whispers to himself) Oh man... Mom is also getting frustrated. TED’S MOM (to Grammy Norma) Mom, seriously--every turn?

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: Hey, back off! (surveys the board) Oooh! No. Ted's head hits the table. Mom stands up. She’s had it. TED’S MOM Okay, Family Time is over! It is now Personal Time, I’1l be in my room! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 3

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: Oh, okay, dear. Have fun! She heads upstairs to her room. As soon as she’s gone Ted turns to see Grammy’s face right next to his.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: I knew I could break her. Go. Ted’s confused. Grammy Norma gestures to the door. GRAMMY NORMA (CONT’D) Go see him! Ted realizes what she means. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah! You rule! Thank you, Grammy! And he runs out the door.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted rides his scooter through the street on his way back the door out of town.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted turns into an alley and runs into someone. He falls o his scooter. He looks up at Mooney and McGurk. Mooney sip from a tiny O’Hare Air can and then crushes it with his fingers. They step aside revealing, Aloysius O’Hare, who uses their hands to walk down to the ground from his car.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Hey, Ted, right? He signs a document and then sticks his pen in the palm o Mooney’s hand. Mooney GROANS.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (a bit creeped out) Uh... Mr. O’Hare. O'Hare gives Mooney and McGurk a look. They close like automatic doors, completely sealing off the alleyway. O’H puts a hand on Ted’s shoulder. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 3

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: So I hear you've become interested in trees. What’s that all about?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (chuckles nervously) Oh, um... Where’d you hear that? O'Hare smiles.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Oh, Teddy, there’s not much that goes on in Thneedville that I don’t know about. (beat) Here’s the deal. I make a living selling fresh air to people. Trees, oh, they make it for free. So when I hear people talking about them, I consider it kind of a threat to my business. (growls)

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: C'mon, I don’t even know what you're talking about, I... O'Hare, furious, gets right in Ted’s face.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Listen to me, boy. Don’t go poking around in things you don’t understand. Or I’1ll be your worst nightmare! I’m Frankenstein’s head on a spider’s body! Ted nods, trying not to freak out.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yeah, um, okay... my mom’s expecting me so I’m just gonna--

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: (chuckles ) Of course, of course, now go back to your family game time. Grandma just finished her turn.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How-- How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Please. I have eyes everywhere. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 4 Mounted security cameras turn to face Ted. The eyes of a BABY IN A BILLBOARD move to look at him. A ROBOT CAT turn its head 180 degrees to stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got a beautiful town here, Ted. Lots of fun stuff to occupy your short attention span. Why I can’t think of any reason you’d ever want to go outside of town again. Ever. O'Hare gestures to Mooney and McGurk, who menacingly straighten the kinked neck of Ted’s scooter and slap Ted’ helmet on his head. They open up the alley exit. Ted quickly scooters away.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calls after him) Okay! Good talk! Really good talk. The three of them get into O’Hare’s car. Ted waits around the corner for the car to leave. He gets determined look on his face, turns around, and scooters toward the end of town.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted arrives out of breath. Runs up to the door and RINGS doorbell. This starts to set off the giant hammer again. Ted’s face falls. He forgot.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh no. He quickly jumps out of the way and tumbles to the ground the Seussian machine does its stuff.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look out! Then calls up to the window.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, man! Hey! You know, you need to change that doorbell! The Once-ler’s eyes appear in the boarded-up window.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Awww, you missed me. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 4

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You’re already back. Clearly you missed me... a little, right?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: No I didn’t. I just-- I’m here to hear the end of the story.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why are you so interested in trees, anyway? Why aren’t you like other kids, break-dancing and wearing bell-bottoms and playing the Donkey Kongs? Ted reacts--"break-dancing”? “Donkey Kong"?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (playing it off) Yeah, right, right... Yeah, I don’t know, I just-- I just, you know, thought it would be kinda cool to have one, you know.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Abhh...It’s a girl, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Pffft! (laughs ) What? No!

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Really? ‘Cause when a guy does something stupid once, well, that’s because he’s a guy. But if he does the same stupid thing twice, it’s usually to impress some girl.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Hey, she is not “some girl.” She's a woman. In high school. And she loves trees and I’m going to get her one. The Once-ler’s yellow eyes stare down from the window, al seeming to smile.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Aww, how nice to see someone so undeterred by things like REALITY. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 4

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (earnestly) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: All right, where did we leave off? EXT: ONCE-LER’S COTTAGE - PAST - NIGHT A Humming-Fish jumps out of the pond and catches a FIREFL his mouth. When he comes back up from the water his eyes glow, scaring his two Humming-Fish friends. INT: ONCE-LER’S COTTAGE - PAST - NIGHT The Once-ler finishes knitting his THNEED. He holds it up admiring it with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Now that’s a Thneed! Nothing unmanly about knitting. No sir. He sets it on a chair. Stifles a yawn. Then crawls into bed, turns out the light, and closes his eyes. He begins SNORING, sound asleep. INT: ONCE-LER’S COTTAGE - PAST - NIGHT CREEEEAK! The sleeping Once-ler doesn’t wake at the sound the door slowly opening. Then the faint sound of tiny footsteps can be heard shuffling across the floor. The Once-ler’s bed raises up off the ground several inche and begins to move toward the door. Lou backs into the stove and burns himself. It’s almost to the door when we hear a THUD! Several animals struggle to carry the Once-ler’s bed. They reach the front door of the house -- the bed won't f

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Look at that-- That-- You-- Oh!

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: (in his sleep) What? Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 4 The animals drop the bed.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: (slaps his forehead) Who taught you guys how to steal a bed? EXT: ONCE-LER’S HOUSE - PAST - LATER The Lorax directs the animals from outside as they finall manage to get the bed out through the window. Melvin sees this and WHINNIES. The Lorax approaches him w some Truffula fruit. Melvin takes it as payment to keep quiet.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Under the pale moonlight, we see THREE HUMMING-FISH hummi the MISSION IMPOSSIBLE THEME. Then the silhouettes of the Lorax and several other animals tiptoe as they carry the ler's bed from his home, down the hill toward a flowing river. Lou runs after them, huffing and puffing, trying t keep up. EXT: RIVERBANK —- PAST — CONTINUOUS The Lorax and the animals come to a halt at the edge of t river. The Lorax smiles as he addresses his accomplices.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: (whispering) Okay, nice and easy. The Lorax and the animals quietly slip the bed into the r and watch as it calmly floats downstream. The Lorax turns the animals, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice work, you guys. Couldn’t’ve done it without you. He turns and waves to the Once-ler as he floats away. The Lorax's face falls as he sees Pipsqueak waving back at hi sitting on top of the sleeping Once-ler and floating downstream.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gotta to be kidding me. Can he swim? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 4

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Pipsqueak’s Mom shakes her head no) Of course he can’t swim! (to Pipsqueak) Hang on, Pipsqueak! I’m coming to getcha! The Lorax and animals take off running along side the floating bed. Lou rolls his eyes and runs after them.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, you fishies! Stop that bed! They swim up to the bed and try to pull it over to the si but the blanket and top sheet rips off, covering them.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: oh! Still sleeping, the Once-ler shivers and grabs Pipsqueak uses him like a blanket. The Lorax points to a LOW-HANGING BRANCH. He directs the animals up the tree.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jump! Jump! C’mon get up there! C’mon! Go go! Little bit more! Little bit more! The branch doesn’t hang low enough.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ugh! Now what? Lorax looks over to see Lou standing next to him stuffing face with fruit. The Lorax struggles to push Lou up the tree.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C’mon! Get up there! Whoa! The branch hangs low enough to reach Pipsqueak. Pipsqueak sees the Lorax and Bar-Ba-Loots hanging from the branch trying to save him. The Lorax stretches out his hand...

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, Pipsqueak, give me your hand. C'mon, reach out for the Lorax. .--but Pipsqueak grabs FRUIT hanging from the tree instea and takes a big bite. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 4

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’d you go? (slaps his forehead) What are you?! Bar-Ba-Loots... The Once-ler’s foot now drops into the water. Like a rudd it re-directs the bed to a side stream. The Lorax’s face falls.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s bad. The bed passes by the Three Humming-Fish standing on a li pad who are HUMMING “TAPS”. Suddenly, Pipsqueak whimpers and a look of terror comes o his face as he looks downstream and sees rapids approachi

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Beanpole! Wake up! Pipsqueak runs to the end of the bed, which flips upside in the water. Then it flips right side up again. The Once ler is covered in fish who quickly jump back off the bed into the water. The Once-ler wakes up, spitting water out of his mouth. H looks at Pipsqueak holding onto the bed frame and waving him. Pipsqueak CHUCKLES NERVOUSLY.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Uh, what’s happening? Where is-- Where am I? Then he sees the Lorax running alongside him on the shore His face falls. The Lorax points to the rapids ahead.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Hey, you got trouble and it’s coming up fast! The Once-ler turns and sees the approaching rapids.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Aaah! We're in a river! The river is picking up speed. Pipsqueak and the Once-ler hold on for dear life as the bed hits the whitewater and up and down.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER AND PIPSQUEAK
dialogues.text: Whhhhhhooooocooaaaaa! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 4 Finally the whitewater ends. The Once-ler and Pipsqueak breathe sighs of relief. They LAUGH at the fact that they survived and then see the waterfall ahead of them.

dialogues.speaker: PIPSQUEAK
dialogues.text: Ewww...

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Oh no. He and Pipsqueak SCREAM in fear. The Once-ler unsuccessfu tries to use his pillow to paddle away from the waterfall He calls to the Lorax.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just do something! The Lorax looks around. Spots a GIANT BOULDER up high abo the waterfall.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Help is on the way! The bed heads closer and closer to the falls.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: (mutters to himself) What the-- Oh no! The Lorax quickly scampers up to the boulder with a STICK Wedges the stick under the boulder. Tries to dislodge it.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Just a minute! He jumps up and down on the stick. The boulder gets dislodged and rolls down the hill. At the end of the hill is a small slope going up, which s the boulder flying. The Once-ler and Pipsqueak, about to go over the waterfal now see a giant boulder flying at them.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER AND PIPSQUEAK
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaaaahhhhhhhhhhhhh! !! THUMP! The boulder connects with the far side of the bed, catapulting the Once-ler and Pipsqueak off of it. The bed crashes over the falls. Violently. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 4 THUD! The Once-ler bounces and slides along the ground on his back, holding Pipsqueak up in the air, so he wouldn’t hurt.

dialogues.speaker: PIPSQUEAK
dialogues.text: Huh. Pipsqueak looks over to the Lorax who appears on the scen seeing the Once-ler lying unconscious. His eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Oooo! Oh no... (slaps the Once-ler) Wake up! Wake up! The Lorax knows what he needs to do, but doesn’t want to it. The animals watch as the Lorax pinches the Once-ler’s nos and tips his head back. He takes a deep breath and lowers his lips to the Once-ler’s. The Lorax comes up and wipes off his tongue. That didn’t work, so he grabs two Bar-Ba-Loots, rubbing them together create a static charge that he uses to shock the Once-ler

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clear! The Lorax jumps back as the Once-ler wakes up. He immediately reaches out and hugs the Lorax.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Haha! I was heading into the light and you pulled me right back and here I am! You saved my life! The Lorax squirms guiltily as the Once-ler hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Yeah, no...I know. Well, no, it’s not that big a deal.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: It is a big deal! Look, I almost went over that waterfall-- (breaks off hug, realizing) In my bed... How did my bed get in the river? The Lorax avoids eye contact with the Once-ler. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 4

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Oh, about that, actually... um...I... (under his breath) Putyourbedinthewater. The Once-ler drops the Lorax.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean you any harm! I just wanted to calmly float you away. (beat) Look, everyone here needs the trees. And you’re chopping ‘em down. So we've got a big problem. The Once-ler looks down and sees Pipsqueak holding on to leg, looking up at him with puppy-dog eyes. Pipsqueak nod The Once-ler looks at all the animals. The Lorax. Finally it begins to sink in. He kneels down and address the animals.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: (holds up his hand to swear) Alright, look, I hereby swear that I will never chop down another tree. I promise! The Lorax looks him over.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Thank you. But I’m gonna keep my eye on you.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Good. Now, I’ve got a big day tomorrow, so I’m going to get some sleep. The Once-ler heads off toward his house. The animals all CHEER. The Once-ler stops and walks back toward the falls

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right after I find my bed. The other Baby Bar-Ba-Loot touches a fish next to him, shocking it. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 4

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: FADE IN on another beautiful morning in Truffula Valley. Reveal the Humming-fish Trio CROWING like roosters on top one of the trees. INT: ONCE-LER’S COTTAGE - PAST - SAME The Once-ler wakes up from a good night’s sleep. Then tur and finds-- The Lorax. Lying next to him in the bed, SNORING. He SCREAMS .

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Aaaaiiiigggghhhhh! This wakes up the Lorax.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Aaaiiiiggghhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER AND LORAX
dialogues.text: Aaaiiiiggghhhhhh!!! Lorax punches the Once-ler.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Ow. Okay, uh... What are you, I-I-- The Once-ler looks around. He turns to the Lorax.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Question... what are they doing here? We reveal his place is filled with animals. Bar-ba-loots curled up at the foot of his bed, Swomee-Swans nesting in light fixtures, and Humming-fish in drawers. A sleeping B Ba-Loot SNEEZES, knocking the Baby Bar-Ba-Loot on it’s stomache onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) And follow up, if I may, what are YOU doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Well, after "the incident” last night we found one of your socks and came here to return it. But when we got here, you were asleep. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 5 Something drops on the Once-ler’s head.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: What? He looks up to see it’s drool from a Bar-Ba-Loot sleeping his lamp.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ew, exactly. And sleeping is the body's way of telling other people to go away.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: I know, but you looked so cozy... and it was cold outside... and we just fell asleep. No harm done. The Once-ler jumps up out of his bed, flustered.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: No harm done? No harm done??? (sighs) Okay... Then he turns to the counter and sees several fish sittin drinking glasses of water, like jacuzzis.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, okay, I put my lips on those. Well, I used to anyway. Then he sees a Swomee-Swan nesting in a large bowl on the counter top. The bird SQUAWKS loudly, then stands up, revealing a FRESHLY-LAID EGG.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ewww! The animals all applaud, proud of her. She high fives another Swomee-Swan. The Once-ler is disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you just...in my bowl?! The Once-ler grits his teeth. The Lorax’s hand grabs the Once-ler’s TOOTHBRUSH out of a glass. He enters the kitchen combing his moustache with t TOOTHBRUSH.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Why do you have one of these? Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 5 He holds it up--it’s filled with yellow LORAX HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t even have a moustache. He hands it to the Once-ler and heads for the fridge. The Once-ler follows him, tossing the toothbrush in the trash

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Okay, that’s it!

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: What? I thought we made a deal last night.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Yes, we did! And I said I wouldn't chop down anymore trees.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: And I said I was going to keep an eye on you. (turns to fridge) I’m starvin’, what’s for breakfast? The Lorax opens the refrigerator, revealing Lou with his cheeks stuffed full with everything in the fridge. He loo out at the Lorax and Once-ler. Busted. Then he shoves the last remaining item into his mouth. An entire STICK OF BUTTER. The Lorax closes the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Breakfast is overrated. The Once-ler looks like he is about to explode, but stops Takes a deep breath and puts his hands in the air.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: You know what? I got work to do. Yup! I gotta go into town and sell my Thneed! The Once-ler holds up the Thneed. The Lorax stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Oh! You chopped down one of my trees to make that piece of garbage? Just look at that--

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Garbage? Oh, no. OH, NO! You do not get it. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 5

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a revolutionary product that will change the world as we know it! The Once-ler walks over to the Bar-ba-loots sleeping on t table and brushes them all off.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It has a million uses! He reaches under the table and pulls up Lou who is now wearing the Thneed as underwear.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at this! It’s a swimsuit! Hup-hey-oh! Then he points to the muddy animal tracks on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mud tracked all over your floor by uninvited guests? Well, the Thneed sure comes in handy for that! Wup- adup-apoh! The Once-ler uses it to wipe up the mud tracks.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But wait, there’s more! Thanks to its all-natural micro-fibers, the Thneed is super-absorbent! Then he goes to the fish swimming a glass filled with wat Shoves the Thneed into the glass. SLUUUURP! It instantly soaks up all the water, leaving the irritated fish standi in the dry glass.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It also works as a hat! He plops the Thneed onto Lorax’s head. SPLURCH! It’s sopping wet and drips all over him. The Lorax gives the O ler a look.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course, you’d probably want to wring it out first, eh-- The Lorax takes the Thneed off his head and throws it at Once-ler. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 5

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Go ahead, go ahead! Knock yourself out. But nobody’s gonna buy that thing!

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Good to know. Well fortunately you’re not the target market. Weirdo. Once-ler strums his guitar.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: You're bringing a guitar?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Oh, I got a little jingle, gonna blow some minds. Gonna sell some Thneeds! He holds up the Thneed defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah... The Once-ler slams the door, waking up a Swommee-Swan, wh HONKS .

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler stands in the middle of town square with his guitar and the Thneed, singing his jingle for all he’s wo

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Everybody needs a Thneed A fine thing that all people-- SPLAAT! The Once-ler is hit in the face with a TOMATO. Th Crowd all LAUGHS at him.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler looks down to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, I didn’t sell the Thneed the first day.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler is back singing in front of the town. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 5

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: The Thneed is good, The Thneed is greaaaat-- Hey! A LITTLE GIRL grabs the Once-ler’s guitar and smashes it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler looks down to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Or the second day.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: SPLAAT! The Once-ler’s hit in the face with a tomato agai SPLAAT! SPLAAT! SPLAAT! It’s an onslaught of rotten tomatoes.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Ow! Oh, hey!

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Or the third. Or the fourth. Or fifth day. Melvin catches one in his mouth and eats it. PULL BACK TO REVEAL a VENDOR with a “TOMATOES FOR SALE, $3.98” CART, and a long line of people buying them to thr at the Once-ler. Next in line is a NUN. Melvin is at the end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That one hit the tender spot. The Once-ler wipes the tomatoes off his face with the Thn

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Until finally...

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: That’s it! You know what? I’m-- I'm done with this thing. The crowd, waiting for their tomatoes, react disappointed

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Awwwwwww... The Once-ler walks around the corner. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 5

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: My family was right! I quit! He takes the Thneed off from around his neck and tosses i over his shoulder where it lands on the head of a GEEKY TEENAGE GIRL, knocking off her glasses and causing her lo hair to unfurl. As she struggles to get it off it becomes hat. She is about to take it off when a COOL GUY passes b

dialogues.speaker: COOL GUY
dialogues.text: Hey, cool hat. Some other TEENAGE GIRLS notice this. Approach the Geeky Teenage Girl.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER TEEN GIRL
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, I totally want one.

dialogues.speaker: YET ANOTHER TEEN GIRL
dialogues.text: That thing makes me like you more. Suddenly everyone in the park notices the Geeky Teenage G and her Thneed. She smiles at all the attention. EXT: ONCE-LER’S COTTAGE - PAST - EVENING Outside of the cottage the Lorax is playing cards with th three animal kids. Lorax plays a card and then sees that Bill has eaten his.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Awww... The Lorax sees the Once-ler approaching. Without the Thne

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, where's your Thneed? Did you sell it?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Hey, yeah, no, ah, no. No, didn’t sell it. Turns out it’s ahead of its time, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Hey, you gave it your best shot, right? What more can you do? Come on, take a seat, we’ll deal you in. The Once-ler smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Ah, what are we playing? Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 5

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: I’m playing poker... (gestures to Gil) He’s playing Go Fish... (gestures to Bill) And I think he’s hungry. Bill pecks one of Gil’s cards out of his hand and eats it

dialogues.speaker: GIL
dialogues.text: Aww.... INT: ONCE-LER’S COTTAGE - PAST - DAY The Once-ler stands at his stove, happily making Truffula berry pancakes.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: (singing) Pancake. Flip-a-dee-boo! He turns around with a fresh stack and we see that his pl is FILLED WITH ANIMALS. He’s cooking for everyone. Pipsqueak is his sous-chef who catches the pancakes on a plate. The Once-ler takes the plate from him and pats him the head.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who is up for ninths? The animals are stuffed. Including one INCREDIBLY FAT HUMMING-FISH. Lou frantically waves his hand.

dialogues.speaker: LOU
dialogues.text: Ooh-ooh-ooh! The Lorax is stuffed and struggles to sit up. He sighs.
