dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Alright, pass ‘em over.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Yeah, see-- The Once-ler brings over the fresh stack. On his way-- RRRRRUUUUUMMBLE! The ground starts to shake. The Once-ler and animals look around.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shaking) What is going on? Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 5 The sound is coming from outside. They head for the door.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler, Lorax and all the animals rush outside. The sound gets louder and the animals run for cover as the Lo and Once-ler turn toward the rumbling sound and see-- DOZENS OF PEOPLE charging over the hill, running toward t Once-ler’s house.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Oh, no. That’s a lot of people. Then he sees they all have cash in hand and all want Thne The animals run away to hide. The Lorax and Once-ler star stunned.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Everybody needs a Thneed! A fine thing that all people need! The Thneed is good! The Thneed is great! Let's hope we're not too late! The Teenage Girl leads the crowd wearing the Thneed as a

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGE GIRL
dialogues.text: It's a super trendy hat! The MAN next to her grabs it and uses it to make a tightr for his ACROBAT WIFE.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: It'sa tightrope for an acrobat! A BOY next to him grabs it (causing the acrobat to fall) uses it as a butterfly net.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: A net for catching butterflies! The FAT GUY next to him grabs the Thneed and uses it like exercise belt, with the Boy still caught in it.

dialogues.speaker: FAT GUY
dialogues.text: A thing you use for exercise!

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Everybody needs a Thneed! (A Thneed! ) A fine thing that all people need! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 5

dialogues.speaker: CROWD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (We need!) Everybody needs a Thneed! The crowd goes crazy, waving their money. The Once-ler ca believe it. Is this really happening? He snatches up the money being shoved at him and turns to the Lorax and anim Waving stacks of cash over his head.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Aww, yeah! We’re in business, baby! The Lorax frowns. Pipsqueak obliviously dances along with the music. Clearly not happy about this.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: We all agree We need a Thneed! We need a Thneed! The Once-ler grabs his PHONE and makes a call.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Mom! Hey, it’s me! I told you I was gonna be a success! You need to bring the whole family here, right now! We’re gonna be rich! (off Lorax’s look) What? I’m gonna need all the help I can get. Don’t worry--- The Lorax looks worried. A dollar floats past camera, wip it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted and Grammy Norma zip through town.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: So has he told you how to get a tree yet?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (calling over the motorcycle) Actually, no... But I think he’s gonna get to that part really soon. Here we are!

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: What?! Ted stops the scooter in front of a SUPERMARKET. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 5 GRAMMY NORMA (CONT’D) (realizes they arrived) Oh, I’1l just be a minute. And she enters the store. Ted waits, then sees Audrey walking towards him carrying CANS OF PAINT.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (to himself) Oh, wow... (calls out) Hey, Audrey! Audrey sees him. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh, hi Ted! What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh, you know me, just cruising. Puttin’ out the vibe... Just me and my thoughts-- Just then Grammy Norma hops on the back of the scooter.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: Ooh, is THIS the girl you’re always talking about? Ted makes a face.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Ah, Gramma, stop making things up!

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: Wow, she’s even prettier than you-- He revs up the engine to cover up any more potentially embarrassing comments and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay, gotta run! Bye! Audrey watches him go with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, Grammy, let’s get you home.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Audrey arrives in the backyard and looks up at her house. She DROPS THE PAINT CANS in horror. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 6 Her mural, the entire backside of her house, has been PAI OVER. Her tree mural is gone. It’s completely white with “Courtesy of O’Hare Inc” logo painted in its place.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted arrives back at the door leading out of town. The but now has a metal plate welded over it with a “PROPERTY OF O'HARE INC.” label on it. He tries to pull the metal plat off the button. It doesn’t budge. He gets frustrated and punches it. He looks around. How’s he going to get out no

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted revs up his scooter. He rides up a curved wall and in through the window of an apartment.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ted scooters through MARKETING GUY #2’s bathroom as he’s taking a shower.

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: (shrieks like a woman) Aaaaiiiiiggghhhhhh!!!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa, hey! So sorry! So sorry! Marketing Guy #2 hits him with his rubber ducky. Ted driv out of the room and up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: My goodness!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (to himself) Did not want to see that! Ted rides his scooter out through the top floor window.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: He lands on a nearby roof and jumps rooftop to rooftop through the city until he jumps over to the wall. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 6

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa! He continues down the steep cliff side on the other side the wall where he bounces down to the ground and continue his way. EXT: LERKIM —- PRESENT - DAY Ted runs up to the Lerkim carrying a BAG OF MARSHMALLOWS. calls up to the Lerkim.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Hey, I’m back! The Once-ler’s arms appear.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What have you got there? (realizes, gasps) Ah, yes! The Once-ler lowers the Whisper-Ma-Phone and Ted pours th marshmallows into it. The Once-ler uses it like a straw t suck them up into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa. There’s silence. The Once-ler’s clearly touched by this gesture.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (chewing) Thank you, Ted. (beat) Now picture this... EXT: ONCE-LER’S COTTAGE - PAST - DAY Gil climbs up to grab a piece a fruit in a tree as Lou watches on. He struggles to pull it off and then falls do to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sun shining... a blue sky... a perfect day. It was all downhill from there. Up above, three Bar-Ba-Loots sleep in the soft tuft until Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 6 RUUUUUMBLE!!! A GIANT RV tears through the valley, obliterating everything in its path. Melvin turns to look and takes off. Gil is stuck to the front of the RV and SCREAMS as it fin comes to a stop next to the Once-ler’s cottage. Gil final falls to the ground with a THUD.

dialogues.speaker: GIL
dialogues.text: Whoa! All of the animals gather around, staring at it as if it a UFO. Then the door in the side opens like a bay door in a flyi saucer. Smoke comes out. And then out steps-- GREAT-AUNT GRIZELDA. An ancient monster of a woman. She looks around.

dialogues.speaker: GREAT-AUNT GRIZELDA
dialogues.text: What a dump! Just then the Once-ler runs over with a smile on his face

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Hey, Aunt Grizelda! Next out are the Once-ler’s moronic brothers, BRETT and C Brett spots Pipsqueak. Immediately picks him up and turns Chet.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Hey, Chet! Check this out! Go long!

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: No, ah, Brett, that’s actually not aum-- Okay. Chet takes off running. Brett then throws a Bar-Ba-Loot l a football.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Go long, go long! Chet looks back over his shoulder and sees the Bar-Ba-Loo coming. Smiles with anticipation. He’s about to catch him when--

dialogues.speaker: CHET
dialogues.text: I got it! I got it! I got-- Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 6 CRASH! He smacks right into the Truffula tree below. The Bar-Ba-Loot grabs onto the tree tuft and then falls onto Chet’s face. CHET (CONT’D) (muffled) --got it! Brett laughs hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: He totally ran into that tree. He slaps the Once-ler’s hand really hard.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Ow! The ONCE-LER’S MOM now exits the RV, stepping on UNCLE UB a step stool. ONCE-LER’S MOM Oncie, is that you?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Mom! She approaches him, a big smile on her face. The Lorax lo at the dead animal stole around her neck, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER'S MOM
dialogues.text: There he is! There’s my big suddenly successful son! (kisses him) We always knew you'd make it, Oncie. (to the family) Right? The entire family responds with smiles and congratulation and displays of affection. Uncle Ubb, lanky and balding, gives him a big hug.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE UBB
dialogues.text: Hey! I love this guy! The Once-ler turns to his mom.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: But you always said I wouldn't amount to anything remember? Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 6 ONCE-LER’S MOM Oh, hush your mouth, I was just trying to motivate you.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: I’m really glad you clarified that, because it actually hurt my feelings for a really long time. The Once-ler breaks away from Uncle Ubb’s hug.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway, ah, you’re all here, you all work for me. And that’s cool. So, let’s get to work! ONCE-LER’S MOM Brett! Chet! Set up the RV! Brett is about to throw another Bar-Ba-Loot. ONCE-LER’S MOM (0.S.) (CONT’D) Would you stop throwing that bear! Chet drops the bear and runs over to the RV. Brett runs after him, stepping on the fallen Bar-Ba-Loot. Chet is about to push a button on the side of the RV, but Brett shoves him out of the way and pushes it. The RV comes to life. It digs posts into the ground and begins expanding. A swing, a TV, a line of laundry, and a satellite dish pop out. A Swomee-Swan flies right into th satellite dish. The finishing touch as a pink LAWN FLAMINGO.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: No, no, no, whoa, whoa, whoa. Time out, back up, stop, don’t move an inch. Nobody’s moving in here. You gotta go, goodbye. The family stares at the Lorax.

dialogues.speaker: GREAT-AUNT GRIZELDA
dialogues.text: So who invited the giant furry peanut?

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: You call me a peanut, huh? I’11 go right up your nose! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 6 Great-Aunt Grizelda seethes, ready for a fight. The Lorax cracks his neck. The Once-ler immediately intercedes, chuckling.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa whoa, you wouldn't hit a woman.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Wha-- That’s a woman?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Okay, everyone cool it. Let’s not get off on the wrong foot here. Um, family, this is my friend--

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Acquaintance.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: --acquaintance, very good acquaintance, the Lorax. He speaks for the trees.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: That’s right. And on behalf of the trees--get out! The Once-ler’s family GASPS. The Once-ler pulls the Lorax aside.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Will you just, be nice? This is my family. And I’m going to need their help if my company’s going to get bigger. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Bigger?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Yeah! This isn’t some rinky-dink operation anymore. I’ve got plans! Big plans! A vision...of a world filled with Thneeds! It’s gonna be huge! The Lorax looks the Once-ler right in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Which way does a tree fall?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Uh...down? Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 6

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: A tree falls the way it leans. Be careful which way you lean. The Lorax gives the Once-ler a sad look, then turns away. The Once-ler watches him go. Then rolls his eyes. INT: ONCE-LER’S COTTAGE - PAST - DAY The Once-ler sits at his desk excitedly working on design for a new factory.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: I mean look at this. It’s amazing. I am so proud of me. ONCE-LER’S MOM Oncie, we've got us a little problem. The Once-ler looks over and sees his Mom standing outside window.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Problem? ONCE-LER’S MOM Mm-hm. See, we’re not making Thneeds fast enough. Uncle Ubb walks by, pushing a large cart full of harveste Truffula tufts.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE UBB
dialogues.text: Harvesting the tufts takes too long. Once-ler looks out the window and sees Brett slowly pick tuft with mechanical gloves at the end of long lazy tongs Then he hands it to Chet who walks all the way over to th cart. It’s clearly the least efficient way to work. The Once-ler turns to his Mom.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Well what else can we do? ONCE-LER’S MOM Well...and this just came to me...we could always start chopping down the trees. Once-ler bolts upright. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 6

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: What? Uncle Ubb walks by pushing the now empty cart.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE UBB
dialogues.text: Woo! Now you’re thinking! That would speed things up. The Once-ler reacts to this, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: But-- ONCE-LER’S MOM No buts, Oncie. You’re running a business now. You have to do what’s best for the company. And your Momma. The Once-ler looks deep in thought. It’s moment of truth time.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Well, I guess it couldn’t hurt to chop down a few trees. The Once-ler’s Mom hugs him through the window. ONCE-LER’S MOM You've made me so proud, Oncie. Come here!

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE UBB
dialogues.text: Hey, I love this guy! Brett and Chet pick up axes and run off.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Lorax plays with the Baby Animals having them balance each other when he hears something. He listens closely to make out what it is. Brett and Chet running through the valley WIELDING AXES, big crazy smiles on their faces. The stack of Baby Animal topples over. Brett and Chet begin CHOPPING down trees. The Lorax sees this and tries to stop them. But it’s no use. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 6

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: No, no, no! Stop it! Please stop! Whoa, whoa!

dialogues.speaker: BRETT AND CHET
dialogues.text: Take that you stupid tree! BOOM! The Lorax sees Brett and Chet going at the trees. Storms toward the Once-ler’s cottage. He’s almost to the door when suddenly Great-Aunt Grizelda appears, stopping him with a pitchfork.

dialogues.speaker: GREAT-AUNT GRIZELDA
dialogues.text: Where do you think you’re going? She scoops him up with the pitchfork and grabs him by the scruff of the neck.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir, I need to talk with your boss. The Once-ler closes the flap of his tent.

dialogues.speaker: GREAT-AUNT GRIZELDA
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry, but Mr. Once-ler’s not seeing anyone right now.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, he’ll see me, so--Hey! Keep your paws off me!

dialogues.speaker: GREAT-AUNT GRIZELDA
dialogues.text: Give me a reason, shortie! The Lorax sees the Once-ler watching from his window.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Hey! You broke your promise! VHHIIPPP. The Once-ler closes his shade. The Lorax reacts getting a heart-breakingly sad look on his face. Calls ou to the Once-ler.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're better than this! You gotta stop! This is bad! Great-Aunt Grizelda wraps the Lorax up in a Thneed. Swing him around like a slingshot, then sends him flying.

dialogues.speaker: GREAT-AUNT GRIZELDA
dialogues.text: Have a nice day! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 6

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler sits in front of a MIRROR with his guitar.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Bad? I’m not bad. I’m the good guy here! He just doesn’t get it. Do you think I’m bad? Bill is perched on the end of his guitar. He HONKS.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you! I mean something good finally happens to me, and he just has to come along and rain on my parade? What’s his problem? Bill HONKS.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See?! The Once-ler strums his guitar. Shaking his head. That Lorax is crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (rolling his eyes) Yeah “bad,” right. The Once-ler strums his guitar again and walks towards th door. Bill HONKS.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler opens the door revealing the beatific landsc in front of him, complete with a rainbow. SONG: “HOW BAD CAN I BE?” The Once-ler leads a group of animals into the valley wit his guitar. All of the animals dance along with the Once- ler.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: How bad can I be? I'm just doin' what comes naturally How bad can I be? I'm just followin' my destiny Lou imitates the Once-ler and shakes his butt along to th music. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 7 The Once-ler walks down a dirt path with the animals following behind him. Great Aunt Grizelda and the rest of the family enter into the frame, sweeping the animals awa

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How bad can I be? I'm just doin' what comes naturally How bad can I be? How bad can I possibly be?

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler slips on his green gloves, puts on his green suit, a bigger green hat, and a pair of sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Well, there's a principle in nature

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: Principle in nature

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: That almost every creature knows Called survival of the fittest

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: Survival of the fittest The Once-ler grabs a guitar and starts playing in the spotlight. Behind him, the Lorax is in another spotlight. He marches toward the Once-ler to confront him, when a tr door opens underneath him and he disappears down it.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: And check it, this is how it goes: The animal that wins got to scratch and fight and claw and bite and punch, And the animal that doesn't Well, the animal that doesn't The Lorax falls down into a cauldron on a table. The Once ler's family pops up holding forks and knives. The Once-l grinds pepper onto the Lorax’s head. The Lorax bounces aw offscreen in the cauldron.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Winds up someone else's La-la-la-la lunch!

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: Munch munch munch munch munch! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 7 EXT: TRUFFULA VALLEY - PAST —- DUSK The Once-ler marches down the street playing his guitar w his family twirling axes behind him like batons. They thr the axes high up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: I'm just sayin’ How bad can I be? I'm just doin' what comes naturally The axes fall down near the Lorax who dodges and weaves t avoid them. The Lorax stops and hold his hand up to say stop.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How bad can I be? I'm just followin' my destiny Then an Axe Hacker drives toward the Lorax and chases him screen. The Axe Hacker chops down trees in it’s path. The biggered factory rises up from behind it.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How bad can I be? I'm just doin' what comes naturally How bad can I be? How bad can I possibly be? Great Aunt Grizelda rides a profit arrow up into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler now has an AMAZING OFFICE. He presents a cha of rising profits to his family.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: There's a principle in business

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: Principle in business

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler rides on the conveyor belt that takes the Truffula tufts into the factory and converts them into Thneeds. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 7

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: That everybody knows is sound It says the people with the money

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: The people with the money The Once-ler walks on a large gear and the Lorax tries to up the other side to catch up with him.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Make this ever-loving world go round Just then, a girder swings into the Lorax and the Once-le hops onto it.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I'm biggering my company And biggering my factory Biggering my corporate sign! As they swing on the girder through the air, the FACTORY grows up around them. The old “THNEEDS” SIGN is replaced with a much bigger one.

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: Bigger bigger bigger bigger bigger!

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Everybody out there, you take care of yours The Lorax slips off the girder and falls down into the On ler’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Many Once-lers pop up from the ground surrounding the Lor

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: I'll take care of Mine mine mine mine mine Great-Aunt Grizelda pops into frame, singing with an incredibly low voice.

dialogues.speaker: GREAT AUNT GRIZELDA
dialogues.text: Shake that bottom line! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 7

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler operates levers that cause the factory SMOKESTACKS spew smog into the air, making flying Swomee- Swans cough.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Let me hear you say Smogulous Smoke!

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: Smogulous Smoke!

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: A MASSIVE PIPE spews SCHLOPPITY-SCHLOPP into a Humming-Fi pond.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Schloppity Schlopp!

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: Schloppity Schlopp! Feathers drops down from above onto the fish, so they loo like they’ve been tar and fathered. The Once-ler reaches down and takes a piece of fruit from Bar-Ba-Loot and eats it.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Complain all you want, it’s never ever ever gonna stop! The Family's large heads pop up from behind a mountain an sing, knocking the animals out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: Sto-o-o-o-p! INT: ONCE-LER’S OFFICE - PAST - DAY The Once-ler walks down the long circular stairs from his desk to the floor in his office. Piles of money rise up f the floor into the air around him.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Come on! How bad can I possibly be?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: How bad can I be? Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 7

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: I'm just building the economy!

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: How bad can I be?

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler pulls on Pipsqueak’s cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Just look at me petting this puppy! Pipsqueak falls to the ground. Paparazzi show up and take pictures of the Once-ler as he drops a PENNY in a TIN CAN marked “Charity” held by an OL MAN.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: How bad can I be?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: A portion of proceeds go to charity! The Old Man removes a fake beard and we see it’s actually Uncle Ubb.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: How bad can I be? A limousine drives through frame and the Once-ler drops t Lorax into the trunk and slams the door. It drives off.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: How bad could I possibly be? Let's see! People wearing Thneeds in different configurations move p camera.

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: How bad can we be?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: All the customers are buying!

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: How bad can we be?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: And the money's multiplying! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 7

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Lorax holds up his hand to the Once-ler and gestures the sickly, hungry animals. The Once-ler walks off as the Lorax grabs his coattails to try to pull him back. The Lorax is stopped by a CAMERAMAN, while someone off sc tosses him a Thneed. FLASH!

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: How bad can we be?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: And the PR people are lying!

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: A billboard shows the Lorax holding a Thneed: “Lorax- approved.”

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: A huge version of the Once-ler rises up from the ground i front of the factory, looming over the valley.

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: How bad can we be?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: And the lawyers are denying!

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: How bad can we be?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Who cares if a few trees are dying? An army of AXE-HACKERS chop down trees left and right. It a nightmarish scene, like Hitler invading Poland.

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY
dialogues.text: How bad can we be?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: This is all so gratifying!

dialogues.speaker: HOW BAD CAN THIS POSSIBLY BE
dialogues.text: Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 7

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Establishing. Now we see a fully mechanized factory worki at full capacity. Smoke bellows from smokestacks as giant mechanical arms load Truffula Trees onto a conveyor belt leading into the monstrous factory. A group of pollution-covered animals sit around a pond of Gluppity-Glupp. One miserable Humming-Fish looks traumatized. In the background, an Axe Hacker continues to chop down m trees.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The busy Once-ler, completely transformed into a big businessman, walks down the halls of Thneeds, Inc. past a large ticker showing the amount of Thneeds sold, “5,268,9 Underneath it is a large poster of the Once-ler with the words, “Too big too fail” written on it. Brett and Chet hold the doors open as he hangs up and ent his office. The doors close behind him. INT: ONCE-LER’S OFFICE - PAST - CONTINUOUS The Once-ler sits down at his desk. Looks over plans for Thneedville. Behind him, we can see the Lorax sitting on his balcony.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: So how are things? The Once-ler turns to see the Lorax.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Happy yet? You fill that hole deep down inside you? Or do you still need more?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Look, if you’ve got a problem with what I’m doing, why haven’t you used your quote, unquote “powers” to stop me? Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 7

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: I told you. That’s not how it works.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Right, I forgot, you’re a fraud. I need you to get out. Now.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Why? Do I make you uncomfortable? Remind you of the promises you made? The man you used to be? The Once-ler confronts the Lorax angrily, backing him dow his balcony steps that lead back down to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: You know what? You can just shut your mustache! My conscience is clear. I have done nothing illegal. I have my rights, and I intend to keep on biggering and biggering and turning more Truffula trees into Thneeds. The Lorax falls backwards and hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And nothing is going to stop me! Just then, in the distance, we hear a THWACK! The Once-le and Lorax both look...and see the VERY LAST TRUFFULA TREE chopped down by a Super Axe-Hacker.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: Well, that’s it. The very last one. (grimly) That may stop you. The Once-ler stares out into the valley. All that can be seen for miles and miles is stumps. The Truffula trees ar all gone.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: TWO WORKERS remove the Thneed ad from a billboard. One of the workers looks up at the image of the Thneed.

dialogues.speaker: TALL WORKER
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Somebody sure made a bundle on that thing. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 7

dialogues.speaker: TALL WORKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wonder what the next million-dollar invention’s gonna be? The Tall Worker fans the smoggy air away from his face, coughing. Then the Short Worker turns around and we see t it is-- A YOUNG ALOYSIUS O'HARE. He watches his partner fanning t smog away from his face, still coughing. Looks up at the billboard, wheels turning. YOUNG O’HARE Yeah. I wonder.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler stands in front of his family’s RV. His moth shakes her head disapprovingly. ONCE-LER’S MOM Son, you have let me down. Brett, you are now my favorite child. VROOM! The RV speeds away. The Once-ler watches it go, his completely deserted facto behind him. He stands there all alone. And then he sees something approaching in the distance. It’s the Lorax, leading a massive crowd of animals. The O ler holds up his hands as they approach.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Hey, look, I don’t want any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: And you won’t get any. Not from them. Thanks to you and your hacking and smogging and glupping, they can’t live here anymore. So I’m sending them off. Hopefully they'll be able to find a better place out there somewhere. He gives the Once-ler a pointed look. The animals continu their march, heading for the horizon. The Once-ler then s Melvin leaving with all of the animals. His face falls.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Melvin? Melvin! The mule looks back, shaking his head in disappointment. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 7

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Pipsqueak. Pipsqueak turns back to the Once-ler who offers him a marshmallow.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. He shakes his head in disappointment and walks off with t rest of the animals. Once the animals are gone, it’s just the Lorax and the On ler. The Lorax stands on a pile of rocks. The Once-ler takes off his biggered hat in shame. Then pulls himself up by the seat of his pants and magica floats up through the air. The Once-ler watches, amazed. The Lorax then disappears through a hole in the smog. The Once-ler is stunned. Who was this guy? What have I done? He looks down at the pile of rocks. We now see that the pile of rocks has the word “UNLESS” carved into one.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted stares down at the word “UNLESS” in the rocks. Ted looks up at the window, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: So this is really all your fault. You destroyed everything.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes. And each day since the Lorax left I’ve sat here regretting everything I’ve done. Staring at that word--"unless”"--and wondering what it meant. (beat) But now I’m thinking...well, maybe you're the reason the Lorax left that word there. Ted looks up, stunned. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 8

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Me? Why would he leave that for me?

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Because unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, nothing is going to get better. It’s not. The Once-ler disappears from view and we hear him furious rummaging around the Lerkim. Finally his arms reappear in the window. He tosses something down to Ted. Ted catches it. It’s a SEED. Ted stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The last Truffula Seed. (beat) You need to plant it, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yeah, but nobody cares about trees anymore.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Then make them care. Plant the seed in the middle of town, where everyone can see. Change the way things are. (beat) I know it may seem small and insignificant, but it’s not about what it is...it’s about what it can become. That’s not just a seed. (beat) Any more than you're just a boy. Ted looks up at the Once-ler, deep in thought. Gets a determined look. His fist closes around the seed. Ted nods. Then walks over to his scooter and starts it up

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (calls out) I won’t let you down. Ted drives off toward Thneedville. The Once-ler’s eyes wa him go. For the first time shining with the hope they had when he was young.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I know. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 8

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted peers out from under a manhole cover. He spots the Robotic Cat surveying the area and throws his scooter hel at him, knocking him out.

dialogues.speaker: ROBOTIC CAT
dialogues.text: Meow. Meow. Meow. Ted revs his scooter and drives right over the Robotic Ca smashing it to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: ROBOTIC CAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Meooocoooow... Thinking he’s alone, he takes out the seed to make sure i okay. In the background, we see the Robotic Cat’s eyes tu on and record him holding the seed.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted stops his scooter in front of Audrey’s house. HONKS h horn.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Hey, Audrey! Audreeeeeey! Audrey opens up the door, covered with paint and holding PAINTBRUSH.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Ted? What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Meet me at my house!

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Wait, but-- And he takes off.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: My house! Okay?! Audrey watches him go, confused.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ted crawls inside. Rushes over to his desk. Sets the seed on it and begins searching around his room, talking to himself. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 8

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Gotta plant the seed. Gotta plant the seed. Okay, we’re going to need...uh... water... Ted grabs a large water bottle and sets it on the desk an looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And...uh...something to dig with... um... What do I have? What do I have?

dialogues.speaker: TED'S MOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ted!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Mom. I’m busy, Mom!

dialogues.speaker: TED'S MOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Theodore Wiggins! Get down here right now and I am not kidding with you! Ted grimaces and exits his room, SLAMMING the door behind him. KA-LUNK! The slamming door causes the water bottle t tip over and water begins DRIPPING on the seed.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ted makes his way down the stairs. Gets to the bottom and turns, seeing-- Aloysius O’Hare and his men standing there. With his moth TED’S MOM Ted, I’d like you to meet Mr. O’Hare--the most powerful man in town.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: There he is. Hello, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Uh...-hi. TED’S MOM Isn‘t he clever, Mr. O'Hare? (forces Ted to shake hands with O'Hare) He knows his own name and everything. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 8

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: (to Ted’s Mom) You know what I would love right now, Mrs. Wiggins? A delicious cookie.

dialogues.speaker: TED'S MOM
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Wonderful. Teddy and I‘1ll stay here and talk. TED’S MOM Sure. Why don’t you go ahead and adopt him?! (laughs ) I’m just kidding. That was a joke. She walks towards the kitchen. TED’'S MOM (CONT’D) I was joking, because you know, I just--I'1l get your cookie. She gives Ted a look. “Be good!” Then leaves the room, escorted by O’Hare’s men. O’Hare turns to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: I know you have it, Ted. So let’s put an end to this nonsense, shall we? Hand it over. O'Hare holds out his hand for the seed. It’s moment of truth time for Ted. He looks O’Hare in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I don’t know what you're talking about. O'Hare frowns.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Really? Well, then I guess you wouldn’t mind us checking your room. Ted’s face falls.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: No-no-no-no! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 8

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Mooney! McGurk! Find the seed! O’Hare’s men return and head upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: No, no! You can’t go up there! Ted tries to push them back down with all his might.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, guys, this is ridiculous! Stop! Hey, ah! O'Hare is behind them, pushing them up with all of his mi

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No you can’t come in my room! Despite his best efforts, they back Ted up the stairs and his door. INT: TED’S BEDROOM - PRESENT - CONTINUOUS Mooney and McGurk knock the door down and burst into the with O'Hare. Ted watches as O’Hare’s men turn the place upside down. H looks nervously at his desk and sees-- THE SEED IS GONE. No longer on the desk where he left it. He looks around, confused. They dig through drawers, empty his closet, turn over his bed, etc. But, of course, don’t find the seed.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Find it! Ted’s Mom enters the room with a plate of cookies. Sees O’Hare threatening Ted. TED’S MOM What? What is going on here?!

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: This doesn’t involve you. Get back downstairs. This does not sit well with her. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 8 TED’S MOM Excuse me down there?! (points) I don’t care who you are you little crazy baby man! Get out of my house! Now! This is outrageous! O'Hare stares back at Ted’s Mom. It’s a stand-off. Finall he lets go of Ted.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Fine. Sorry. Must’ve been a misunderstanding. We’1ll be leaving now. (to Ted) And my apologies, Ted. (gives him a threatening look) You be safe. Ted gulps at this threat. O’Hare heads for the grabs the plate with the cookie on the way out. Ted and his mom listen for the front door slam. TED’S MOM What? Mind telling me what’s going on here? Ted begins furiously searching his desk for the

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: The seed! Where is it?! TED’S MOM Seed? And then Ted finds Grammy’s cane under his desk

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Where’s Grammy?! door and seed. He smiles. He takes off running out of the room. His mom follows him

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ted and his mom arrive to find Grammy Norma standing in t family room holding the seed, which now has a tiny sprout and admiring it, mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: It’s alive. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 8 She whispers to the seed. GRAMMY NORMA (CONT’D) I remember you. Ted and his mom join Grammy, caught up in the wonder of t spouting seed. Clearly moved by it. TED’S MOM Ted, what-- (gasps ) DING-DONG! DING-DONG! It’s the doorbell. Ted runs and opens it, revealing Audrey. Smiles upon seeing her.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Audrey. With the door open, Ted can see the O’Hare Air truck park right across the street. His face falls.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Hey, did you want to-- He quickly pulls Audrey inside and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, okay! Ted closes the door and shuts the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ted, what is this about? Ted holds up the seed for Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: It’s about this.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait-- Is that?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yes. The last Truffula seed. And you're going to help me plant it right in the middle of town. Where everyone can see it. Audrey looks at Ted, impressed with his take-charge attit

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I could just kiss you right now. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 8 TED’S MOM We don’t have time for that!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I don’t know, we have a little time... (feeling awkward) But, you know what? Let’s just go! Let’s go. Forget about it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Mooney sits in an O’Hare Air truck reading a newspaper. Across the street, the garage door opens and Ted’s Mom pu out into the street and peels out. She flies right by the O'Hare Air truck and Mooney sees Ted in the passenger’s s Mooney quickly takes off after her. INT: TED’'S MOM’S CAR - PRESENT - SAME Ted’s Mom drives like crazy, in and out of traffic loving that she is taking Mooney for a ride.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: She drives her small car in between two rows of traffic that’s too small for the truck. Mooney engages the truck’ nitros, which blasts him through traffic like a rocket, knocking the other cars off the road. Ted’s Mom sees the truck gaining on her in the rear view mirror. TED’S MOM Oh! Here it comes! The truck bumps her car from behind. She sees a street up ahead that’s blocked off by traffic cones. TED’S MOM (CONT’D) Whoa! I’m going for it! She makes a quick turn down the street. She looks back to see the O’Hare Air truck is still following her. Then tur back around to find the road ahead is out. She SCREAMS and slams on the brakes, stopping just short the edge. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 8 Mooney jumps out and flings open the passenger door. He s a FAKE TED MADE OF AN O’HARE AIR BOTTLE. TED’'S MOM (CONT’D) Oh, hello... Ted’s Mom LAUGHS at him. Mooney GROWLS IN FRUSTRATION.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ted, Audrey and Grammy race through the neighborhood on T scooter (Audrey holding on to Ted and Grammy Norma in the back). Audrey sees the shadow of O’Hare’s blimp rising ov them.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Ted, Ted! Big scary blimp coming! Ted sees the blimp catching up to them. O'Hare LAUGHS as he locks a strap around his waist. McGur fires up a rocket pack helmet and dives off the blimp tow Ted's scooter. We reveal O’Hare strapped to his chest lik baby bjorn. He holds a bull horn in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: You won’t get away with this, boy! Bam! O'Hare and McGurk weave in and out of traffic past the fu cars we saw in Thneedville. They get stuck behind a Man riding a very tall scooter. O’Hare calls to him on the megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go faster, you idiot! McGurk slaps the Man out of the way as they take off afte Ted.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: Step on it, Ted! Ted makes a hard turn. Mooney drives out of a tunnel towa them and Ted makes an evasive maneuver around the tunnel wall, narrowly avoiding him. McGurk and O'Hare turn the corner, heading towards Mooney truck. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 8

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Whaaa! SLAM! McGurk and O'Hare slam into Mooney’s windshield and slide off like squashed bugs.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEY
dialogues.text: Oooh...

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: (squashed against the windshield) You're fired! Grammy Norma LAUGHS as she think they’ve escaped, but O’H gets up and takes chase on foot.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: Whoa, Ted, look out! Ted turns back around and sees he’s gone off the road. An is heading right towards an OPEN ELEVATOR leading to the PARK.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa! People in the elevator SCREAM. SCREEECH! Ted slams on the brakes. The scooter spins and comes to a gentle stop insi the elevator next to a LITTLE BOY holding a kite. They look outside the elevator and see O’Hare and his goo running toward them.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Ted... Ted, panicking, presses the “CLOSE DOORS” button repeated O'Hare and his goons are getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Nobody beats--! The doors close just in the nick of time. DING.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Everyone on the elevator stars awkwardly at Ted, Audrey, Grammy Norma. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 9 EXT: KITE PARK - PRESENT -— CONTINUOUS DING! The elevator doors open, and they speed out into th Kite Park, which is at the top of Thneedville’s tallest building. Ted weaves in and out of the KIDS flying kites powered by GIANT FANS. They stop at the edge of the building.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Not good! How's it doing? Audrey looks down at the seed and O’Hare spots it from do in the street with his binoculars. McGurk gives him a gun that shoots metal pinchers. He fires it at Audrey, but misses the seed and grabs onto one of the giant fans behi them.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Loser!

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Oh, really? O'Hare tugs the line redirecting the fan toward them. WHOOOOOSH! The power of the fans BLOWS the seed right out Audrey’s hand!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh no. The seed! The three of them watch helplessly as the seed flies up i the air. From the ground, O’Hare spies it with his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: (to his goons) Get that seed! McGurk goes after it on his scooter as O’Hare hops in the sidecar. Up above, Ted sees this and revs up his scooter.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Hang on! Here we go! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 9 He rides off the edge of the roof, landing in the snow of ski slope below. SWOOOSH! Grammy falls off.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Grammy! Grammy Norma pushes a GUY off his snowboard and borrows i catch up with Ted’s scooter. She gets her legs and starts to have fun.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh, wow! Seriously?! How cool is your Gramma?! She blows a kiss to a SKIER, who does a double take, not watching where he’s going. The Skier slams right into a f fir tree. Ted watches as the seed continues falling past the ski sl toward the ground.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: No! Grammy Norma pulls to a stop at the bottom and Ted catche with her.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cc’mon!

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Down below in the street, O’Hare spots it with his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: There it is! The seed floats down and lands right inside the empty air bottle. The O’Hare Delivery Man goes to pick up the bottle, but s O’Hare’s trucks coming right at him and runs away.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey! Watch the road, you meathead! Still looking through the binoculars while driving, Moone accidentally crashes his truck into the building. And all of the EMPTY AIR BOTTLES in the back spill out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 9 There must be hundreds of them. They all begin ROLLING do the hilly street, sweeping the bottle with the seed in it with them. It’s an awesome sight as they all roll and bou down the hill. The bottles smack O’Hare in the face and t one with the seed bounces by before he can grab it.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, ow-ow-ow! Oh! C’mon! McGurk turns the scooter around and goes after it. Just then, Ted’s scooter approaches at the bottom of the hill. O'Hare catches up to the bottle with the seed and grabs i LAUGHING in victory. But his hand gets stuck and he can’t reach the seed.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the--?! He holds out his arm to Mooney in the other truck.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get it unstuck! Get it unstuck! Ted drives toward him playing chicken.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bring it on, Teddy! You don’t have the guts! Grammy SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Ted! At the last second, Ted leans the scooter over and skids underneath O’Hare and the bottle. It goes into slo-mo.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (in slo-mo) Grammy! Grammy hooks the bottle with her cane and yanks it away f O'Hare. Ted rights the bike and the scene goes back to normal spe

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yeah! Yes! Wahoo! McGurk is distracted and they head right toward the two Marketing Guys sharing a milkshake at an outdoor cafe. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 9

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey!

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUYS
dialogues.text: (in unison) Hey, it’s Mr. O--! SMASH! Ted speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: Take that shorty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted drives up onto the curb and screeches to a halt right the center of town by the STATUE OF O’HARE. Ted, Audrey a Grammy Norma quickly get off the scooter. Grammy Norma hi her cane against the ground, but it’s paved over.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay, we have to get this in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: But where? There’s no dirt anywhere!

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: Ooh! Grammy Norma smiles and scampers over to the BULLDOZER pa by the “COMING SOON! ANOTHER PARKING LOT!” construction site. Climbs into the cab.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: No, um, Grammy... BA-RUUUUMMMBLE! She fires up the bulldozer and starts pulling levers. The bulldozer growls like a dinosaur and immediately begins spinning out of control. VRRRRUUUUMBL!

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: Whoopsy! She pulls another lever and the bulldozer arm swings arou and severs the head off the O’HARE STATUE. The head falls the ground, cracking open the pavement and revealing-- A PATCH OF DIRT. The bulldozer stops. Grammy Norma climbs down to join the Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 9 GRAMMY NORMA (CONT’D) See? What’d I tell you? Easy. Huh? WOMAN (0.S. Hey! Then they turn to find dozens of townspeople have gathere see what the commotion is.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They broke O’Hare’s head!

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER WOMAN
dialogues.text: What do you think you’re doing, kid? Ted stares at the crowd. Busted.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Um...I’m...I’m looking for a place to plant a tree. A real one.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Why would we need a tree?

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Exactly. Everyone turns and sees O’Hare leaning on his broken stat head. All eyes are on him. Ted cringes.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (to himself) Oh, man. O'Hare addresses people in the crowd individually like a politician.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Folks, the last thing you want around here is trees. They’re filthy, spewing that sticky, nasty sap all over the place. (to Marie) They bring poisonous ants and stinging bees. He sticks his finger into Marie’s ice cream cone. Then li it off.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Hey!  Dr. The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 95.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Ouch. (to the Marie’s Mom) Think about the kids. Marie runs to her Mom, scared.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to a Maintenance Worker) And... I just thought of, you know, they make leaves! I mean, you know that right?! And these leaves they just fall. They just fall where ever they want. The Crowd GASPS. A MAN in the Crowd faints. The crowd murmurs, concerned. The tide is definitely agai Ted.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) Oh COME ON! We know why you’re REALLY against trees! Because they produce fresh air! O'Hare frowns.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) For free! The crowd starts murmuring at this.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: (gasps) I am wounded! You have lied!

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: It is not a lie! It’s called photosynthesis!

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Oh, come on! She's making that up! That’s a made up word, people! Thneedville is perfect just the way it is. We don’t need trees! (points accusingly at Ted) That boy has a seed! We need to stop him! Who’s with me? C’mon!

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: O’Hare’s right! Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 9

dialogues.speaker: MARKETING GUY
dialogues.text: Seeds will ruin us all!

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Stop it! Yeah! I’m afraid of bees! Grab him! O'Hare moves menacingly toward Ted, the crowd following h

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Last chance, kid. Hand it over. Audrey turns to Ted. What do we do now? Ted gets an idea. Quickly hops up onto the bulldozer.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where do you think you’re going?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (to Grammy and Audrey) C'mon, let’s go. Get in. Get in! They join him in the bulldozer’s cab. He hands Audrey the seed and puts the bulldozer in gear and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Stop that maniac! Ted HONKS the HORN and O’Hare runs out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Excuse me! Excuse me! Watch out! The bulldozer drives out of Town Square and O'Hare runs a them. The crowd follows. Ted heads straight for the wall surrounding the town.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Ted, you’re gonna hit the wall!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. SMASH!!! The bulldozer connects with the wall. Then...CRACK. A line appears in the wall. It grows...and expands...until finally a huge section of it CRUMBLES to ground. Revealing the desolate landscape outside. Everyon stares in stunned silence. O’Hare tries take the focus of the landscape.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Wow! Did you see that? Who does this kid think he is? Huh? Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 9 Ted leaps onto the top of the bulldozer.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I am Ted Wiggins. (beat) And I speak for the trees. (beat) And the fact is things aren’t perfect here in Thneedville. And they’re only going to get worse unless we do something about it. Unless we change our ways. And we can start by planting this! Ted holds up the seed. The crowd GASPS IN AWE as the litt sprout opens up, revealing the first signs of a tuft. O’H grimaces. Addresses the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Okay, come on now, everything's fine. Right? I say we tell this kid what we think about that seed! People, c’mon! The crowd doesn’t know what to do. O’Hare pulls the Singi Delivery Man aside.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You! Get out there right now and get these people on my side! Or else you’re fired! (so crowd can here) Go on! Tell ‘em what you think! SONG: “LET IT GROW”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Singing Delivery Man stares at all the people.

dialogues.speaker: SINGING DELIVERY MAN
dialogues.text: You don't know me, but my name's cy, I'm just the O'Hare Deliver Guy, But it seems like trees might be worth a try, So I say let it grow Ted and Audrey smile at this. O’Hare frowns. What? Then a couple, DAN and ROSE, step forward, emboldened by the Sin Delivery Man's words. They address the crowd. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 9

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: My name is Dan

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: And my name's Rose. Standing next to them is their son, the Glowing Boy.

dialogues.speaker: DAN AND ROSE
dialogues.text: Our son Wesley kind of glows. And that's not good, so we suppose We should let it grow! Several members of the crowd nod, agreeing. Ted’s Mom addresses the crowd. TED’S MOM Let it grow Let it grow Ted looks up at his Mom, impressed by her amazing singing voice.

dialogues.speaker: MAINTENANCE WORKERS
dialogues.text: You can't reap what you don't sow. Plant a seed inside the earth, People from around the town hear them sing and walk over join the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: TED'S MOM, SINGING DELIVERY MAN, AND
dialogues.text: MAINTENANCE WORKERS (CONT’D) Just one way to know its worth, Let's celebrate the world's rebirth- We say let it grow! The little girl, Marie, steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: My name's Marie, and I am three I would really like to see a tree The crowd reacts to her undeniable cuteness.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Awwwwwww...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: La la la la la la la la la la lee I say let it grow Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 9 Grammy Norma slides down from the bulldozer and addresses crowd.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY NORMA
dialogues.text: I'm Grammy Norma, I'm old, and I've got gray hair But I remember when trees were everywhere The crowd is moved by this. O’Hare can see he’s losing ground. GRAMMY NORMA (CONT’D) And no one had to pay for air (pokes O'Hare with her cane) So I say let it grow! The whole crowd now joins in on the chorus. O’Hare can se he’s losing ground. Ted leads everyone back down towards town square.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Let it grow Let it grow Like it did so long ago! It is just one tiny seed But it’s all we really need It's time to change the life we lead Time to let it grow! Now O'Hare steps out of the middle of the crowd onto the of his severed statue’s head.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: My name's O'Hare, I'm one of you, I live here in Thneedville too. The things you say just might be true, It could be time to start anew, And maybe change my point of view... Everyone is touched by O’Hare’s willingness to change.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Naw! I say let it die! O'Hare now tries to get everyone singing with him.

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let it die Let it die (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 1

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let it shrivel up and... (no one’s singing along) Come on! Who’s with me? Huh? The crowd just stares back at him. Even his own men look away.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: SINGING DELIVERY MAN
dialogues.text: You greedy dirtbag! Everyone surrounds O’Hare and points to him accusingly.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Let it grow Let it grow Let the love inside you show Mooney slaps the rocket helmet to O’Hare’s head and sends flying off screen.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Plant a seed inside the earth, Just one way to know its worth, Let's celebrate the world's rebirth-- We say let it grow!

dialogues.speaker: O'HARE
dialogues.text: Nooooo00000 !

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Let it grow Let it grow You can't reap what you don't sow

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Once-ler’s eyes appear in the boarded up window. He looks toward Thneedville, trying to make out the faint mu he hears in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: TOWNSPEOPLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It is just one tiny seed But it’s all we really need The Once-ler turns his ear to the window, but it’s still faint. He disappears back inside his Lerkim. Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 1

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: It’s hard to make out anything in the dark and shadowy ro Then the Once-ler’s gloved hands appear, grabbing the han of a RUSTY OLD AXE next to the Great-Great-Great Grandfat snail on his desk. We can barely make out the silhouette the Once-ler raising the axe over his head, then...

dialogues.speaker: TOWNSPEOPLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's time to banish all your greed WHACK! He chops away at the boards covering his window. WHACK! CRACK! The axe breaks through the boards and sunlight shines into the room for the first time in years

dialogues.speaker: TOWNSPEOPLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Imagine Thneedville flowered and treed! Then, the Once-ler steps into the light and moves toward window. We see his face for the first time. Old and wrinkled, with an enormous, Lorax-like moustache. The Old Once-ler leans out of the window and listens. Far off in distance, he hears voices singing.

dialogues.speaker: TOWNSPEOPLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Let this be our solemn creed! The Once-ler’s sad old eyes slowly widen as he realizes w he’s hearing. Tears begin to well up as he looks down at “Unless” stones below him, then back toward Thneedville. proud smile creeps across his face.

dialogues.speaker: ONCE-LER
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ted. EXT: TOWN SQUARE - PRESENT —- SAME The crowd of people watch as Ted and Audrey prepare to pl the little seed into the ground. Rocks surround the hole a protective circle (an echo of what the Lorax and animal did earlier).

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: We say let it grow (in Thneedville) Audrey leans in and surprises Ted with a kiss on the chee His eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We say let it grow (it's a brand new dawn) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Seuss' The Lorax 1-6-12 Final Locked Reels Conform 1

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We say let it grow (in Thneedville) We say let it grow It's a brand new dawn... Grammy Norma walks over with a watering can as Ted plants seed. She waters it and the tree begins to grow towards camera in time-lapse. EXT: LERKIM —- PRESENT - DAY Cross dissolve from the sapling in Town Square to one gro in the desolate wasteland outside of the Lerkim. The Old Once-ler steps outside with a watering can in han He makes his way over to the UNLESS stones where some sma patches of grass are beginning to grow around the tiny Truffula tree. The Once-ler carefully sprinkles water on a few saplings smiles. Then, he hears a faint sound off in the distance. The same sound he heard when the Lorax disappeared into t sky years ago. He looks up and sees the smoggy clouds beginning to part. ray of sunshine falls upon him and a SWOMEE-SWAN swoops d from above. The amazed Once-ler watches the bird fly by t turns to the UNLESS stones where he sees-- The Lorax. Floating back down to the stones. Smiling. The Once-ler can’t contain himself and LAUGHS IN Joy.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX
dialogues.text: You done good, beanpole. You done good. The Old Once-ler kneels down and gives him a hug.

dialogues.speaker: LORAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By the way, nice mustache. FADE TO BLACK. TITLE CARD: “Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, nothing is going to get better. It’s not.” -- Dr. Se FADE TO BLACK.
